title: Market Data Analyst
Security Engineer
description:
### **Function**


Do you want to make a difference and contribute to creating a better world? Are you interested in developing your skills and knowledge, while putting your ideals to work? Join us, we are a frontrunner in ethical banking and global impact investing, and we need people like you to make change happen.



We believe that money can change the world for the better. In fact, our organisation was founded on this belief. Our mission is to create a society that protects and promotes the quality of life of all its members with human dignity at its core.



Triodos Bank wants to preserve the trust of their customers as a custodian of their money and their personal data. Realising and maintaining secure IT systems and working procedures are vital to achieve this goal. Currently to strengthen cybersecurity defences activities we are looking for an experienced Security Engineer.

### **Profile**

**How you will make a difference**



You will help us to ‘change finance to finance change’, by playing a central role in the cyber defense strategy of Triodos Bank. You are an advisor on security aspects to other ICT teams and will coordinate the implementation of changes and improvements to our cyber defences. You will work closely together with the Security Operations Centre and assess the impact of alerts and incidents. Some of the changes on our roadmap relate to topics that will have a big impact on our IT organisation in the future, such as adoption of AI and a continuous growing cloud environment.





Together with the team:


* You will support ICT and the security team with your expertise on (cyber) security, with a focus on constant improvement and development of our cyber defences.
* You will be a knowledge and sparring partner for the SOC analysts from our security partner that operates the Triodos Security Operations Centre.
* You will maintain a network within the bank and outside the bank to gather and share knowledge on cybersecurity
* You will dive into the world of cyber security and help to improve the cyber resilience of the bank and particular of our ICT infrastructure
* You will be working in the following processes: vulnerability scanning, baseline compliance scanning, threat intelligence & assessment, security incident management, change management, attack surface management, penetration and red team testing (organising), security monitoring, security architecture and product selection.


**What you will bring**



Your unique potential and your values matter for us most. We look for people who are self-aware and who think in a holistic way, always conscious about their impact on society, environment, and the economy.





To be successful in this role, you will:


* enjoy working in teams and building relations, inside and outside of the bank
* come up with appropriate advice or approaches to the security issues you encounter
* use your creativity and learning ability while facing challenges


Furthermore, it is expected that you will have:


* relevant experience with IT security, preferably in financial industry
* strong background in ICT and information security (CISSP+ level)
* strong interest in technology, and ability to grasp the concepts of information technologies and the application of security for those technologies
* good communication skills in English and preferably Dutch
* preferably CISSP, CEH or CSX certification
* hands on experience with Cloud, SIEM and/or SOAR technology, as a plus


**Your future colleagues**



You will be member of the Cyber Defence Centre (four people) within Risk & Resilience at Triodos Bank Head Office. On a daily basis, the team works closely with the colleagues from an external security partner that provides the Security Operations Centre services for Triodos Bank.

### **Offer**

**What we offer you**


**An inspiring work culture**

The most important thing about working with us is that you are part of community that is changing the world for the better. We are constantly improving our work culture to create conditions where every person can thrive, so you are able to:





* find a sense of meaning in your work
* create positive energy and impact with your co-workers
* build mutual trust and respect in working relationships
* enjoy fulfilment at a professional and personal level


**A comfortable working environment**


Our award-winning sustainable head office is based in Driebergen-Zeist, the Netherlands at the Reehorst Estate, just a 3 minutes’ walk from the train station. Combined with working from home, it is an inspiring place to work and connect with your colleagues.





**And of course, great remuneration and working conditions:**





* a salary appropriate to the position, our remuneration policy and your experience
* an attractive pension policy
* a mobility card (including free private travels)
* flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from home
* reimbursement of a company bicycle to the max of € 1,500
* 30 holiday days with a 40-hour working week, plus the option of buying 2 weeks of extra holiday days
* extra leave to contribute to voluntary work
* a range of education and training opportunities
* the option to join our collective health insurance
* a working from home allowance per home office day
* suitable home office equipment up to € 750 every 5 years


**Sounds interesting?**



If you feel that you want to make a difference, don’t hesitate to join the Triodos community by applying for this role.



Everyone is welcome to join us. Our culture is built on values that aim to benefit both society and individuals. We are committed to equity and diversity, and we value everyone’s perspective. We strive to create an environment in which all co-workers and our broader community can feel safe and included.


**The closing date for applications is: 19.07.2024**



If the role interests you but you still have some questions, please connect with us via email: careers@triodos.com. If there are any additional adjustments you may need during the application process, please let us know.



We also don’t want to miss out on candidates who feel they don’t exactly match the job description, so if this is a role that sounds interesting to you, and you feel you could add value, please apply!



\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_


**Who we are**


**Triodos Bank** is a leading expert in sustainable banking, founded in 1980 in the Netherlands, with branches in Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, and Spain.


**Triodos Investment Management** is a globally recognised leader in impact investing, that currently manages 20 funds invested in both Europe and emerging markets.


**Triodos Regenerative Money Centre** is our business unit launched in 2019 with the explicit goal of restoring and regenerating nature and society.



We are a certified **B Corp** since 2015. B Corp is a growing global community of successful and sustainable companies that create positive social impact and change.



We are also one of the founders of The Global Alliance for Banking on Values, a global network of independent banks using finance to deliver sustainable economic, social, and environmental development.



www.triodos.com | www.triodos-im.com | www.triodosfoundation.nl
company_description: Triodos Investment Management is a wholly owned subsidiary of Triodos Bank, one of the world's leading sustainable banks.

title: Business Analist
description:
### **Wij vragen**


HBO / WO opleiding of denkniveau.
Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring.
Een stevige gesprekspartner die op verschillende niveaus kan opereren.
Je bent in een pro in het scheiden van de hoofd- en bijzaken.
Je beschikt over kennis van procesoptimalisatiemethoden en evt. datamanagement oplossingen.
Ervaring met agile scrum werken is een pré.
Opereert zelfstandig, in lijn met doelstellingen, processen, procedures, beleid en budget en stemt indien nodig af met stakeholders.
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en een toegankelijke persoonlijkheid.
### **Wij bieden**


Je komt te werken in een informele, missie gedreven organisatie waar duurzaamheid centraal staat.
Salaris ligt tussen de € 4.081,00 en € 5.829,00, afhankelijk van o.a. relevante kennis, vaardigheden en ervaring die je meebrengt.
Laptop en telefoon.
Een uitdagende, verantwoordelijke en zelfstandige functie en een hecht team dat continu samen wil verbeteren.
28 verlofdagen bij fulltime dienstverband, hybride werken en een goede pensioenregeling.
Mogelijkheid tot werken met de nieuwste software.
Ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en toegang tot INNAX Online Academy.
Steun voor jouw sportieve ambities (fietsregeling, regeling voor bedrijfsfitness bij ca. 3.200 sportlocaties).
  
**Wat doe je als Business Analist?**
------------------------------------

Weet jij van nature de vraag achter de vraag te herkennen en ben jij toe aan een volgende stap in je loopbaan? Lijkt het je mooi om te werken binnen een organisatie waarbij duurzaamheid centraal staat en waar volop kansen ontstaan naar aanleiding van de Energietransitie? Als je nu denkt; ja! Lees dan vooral verder.



Als Business Analist onderzoek én analyseer je businessprocessen, informatiestromen en behoeften aan het begin en gedurende een project. Dit doe jij in samenwerking met de producteigenaar en de betrokken business stakeholders (inclusief team data en IT).



Mede dankzij jouw inzet wordt de businessvraag duidelijk en sluit de oplossing aan op de gewenste verandering. IT en softwareontwikkeling is hierbij vaak een essentieel onderdeel voor de invulling van de verandering. De focus ligt hierbij op de software die de business unit Meten ondersteunt, waarbij jouw aandacht voornamelijk ligt bij de transitie naar het nieuwe energie data platform Energyworx en het ontwikkelen van een data gedreven visie.

  



Een greep uit je takenpakket:


* Je bent het eerste aanspreekpunt voor het uitwerken van veranderingen voor de business.
* Onderzoekt en analyseert businessprocessen, informatiestromen en behoeften en vertaald deze in resultaat gerichte oplossingen naar businessplannen.
* Draagt de businessplannen op een heldere en enthousiaste manier uit en creëert hiermee draagvlak, ook richting het MT.
* Analyseert de benodigde informatie en documenten.
* Stelt functionele specificaties (functioneel ontwerp/userstories/requirements) op en stemt deze af met de productowner.
* Je bent klankbord tijdens het project voor diverse stakeholders
* Houdt ontwikkelingen en innovaties bij voor het eigen aandachtsgebied (o.a. technische kennis en goed begrip van IT) en ziet de impact hiervan en zorgt voor een juiste kennisniveau bij zichzelf en anderen.
* Draagt actief bij aan de visie, strategie en jaarplannen voor data/IT processen en onderhoudt daardoor een breed netwerk in de organisatie.


Kortom, als Business Analist ben je de drijvende kracht achter het inventariseren en concretiseren van abstracte multidisciplinaire vraagstukken, waarvoor een helicopterview en goed begrip van de business unit nodig zijn.


#### **Over het team**



Interne Organisatie heeft een faciliterende rol aan de business waarbij de afdeling IT een cruciale rol heeft. Deze afdeling bestaat uit 20 gemotiveerde medewerkers die zich elke dag inzetten om de business te verbeteren, waarbij het zwaartepunt van de Business Analist op de business unit Meten ligt. Door de brede vraag van deze unit is er tussen verschillende product-teams veel uitwisseling van kennis en uitvoering van de werkzaamheden. Dit maakt ons een divers, betrokken en gezellige afdeling.


*Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.*
company_addresses: We hebben drie kantoren verspreid over Nederland, dus altijd bij jou in de buurt.
company_description: Bij INNAX werken we aan een toekomst waar iedereen energie van krijgt. Is dat de missie waar jij je ook dagelijks voor in wilt zetten? Dan zoeken we jou.

title: Trainee Data Adviseur Overheid
description:
Overheidsorganisaties zijn sterk in ontwikkeling en zij bezitten tevens een schat aan data. Data die bij goed gebruik een geweldige kans biedt om als organisatie nog meer voor de omgeving te kunnen betekenen. Want het juist benutten van data kan veel moois bieden.

Wil jij jouw omgeving verbeteren en mooier maken? Ben jij technisch sterk, goed in analyseren en communicatief vaardig? Dan past het Traineeship Data Adviseur Overheid misschien wel goed bij jou!

Binnen de periode van ongeveer anderhalf jaar ontwikkel je binnen ons traineeship een uitstekende en uitgebreide basis voor verschillende functies binnen het vakgebied van Data-management. Denk daarbij aan rollen als: BI Consultant en Data Adviseur, maar ook als Data Analist, Data Scientist of Data Engineer. Je kunt binnen het Traineeship aan de slag bij onder meer Gemeenten, Omgevingsdiensten, Ministeries, Provincies, Waterschappen of Rijksdiensten in Nederland.

**Wat is jouw belangrijkste bijdrage in deze rol?**

Als (junior) Data Adviseur werk je binnen een dynamisch vakgebied waar je na de start van het Traineeship verschillende taken kan tegenkomen:

* Meedenken om de essentie van een vraag en behoefte van een afdeling of team te achterhalen;
* Adviseren over het gebruik, de mogelijkheden en de toepassing van data;
* Inventariseren, analyseren en integreren van (potentiële) datastromen en datasets;
* Data visualiseren middels o.a. dashboards en datamodellen;
* Uitleg geven over data(gebruik) en trainen van gebruikers in datagedreven werken;
* Ondersteunen bij de veranderopgave van datagedreven werken;
* Technologie inzetten om grote en complexe datasets te beheren en beschikbaar te stellen;
* Datasystemen ontwerpen en rapportages opstellen;
* Implementeren en/of beheren van data analyse software.

Je wordt de spil tussen de data en de gebruikers, je helpt hen bij de vragen en uitdagingen die ze hebben en adviseert ze over de potentie en mogelijkheden.

Vanaf de start van het Traineeship Datamanagement volg je een vakinhoudelijke opleiding die jou voorziet van de benodigde kennis over het vak en de veelgebruikte tools om een mooie carrière op te kunnen bouwen.

**Functie-eisen**

Het Traineeship Datamanagement is toegankelijk voor starters met een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding. Een breed aantal afstudeerrichtingen kunnen passend zijn. Veel voorkomende studies zijn Data Science, Bestuurskunde, Bedrijfskunde, maar ook Wiskunde, Psychologie en andere studies waarbij je veel met onderzoek en analyse te maken hebt (gehad).

Je beschikt over de volgende eigenschappen:

* In het bezit van een recentelijk afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding;
* Analytisch ingesteld, gestructureerd en accuraat;
* Gedegen basiskennis van data-analysetechnieken, -tools en -methodologieën.
* Initiatiefrijk en communicatief sterk;
* Enthousiasmerend, sensitief, en servicegericht;
* Affiniteit met programmeren in bijvoorbeeld python en/of R;
* Affiniteit met IT, techniek en de overheid

We vinden het belangrijk dat je over technische affiniteit beschikt en met programmeertalen aan de slag bent geweest. Denk hierbij aan Python, SQL of R. Daarnaast is het een groot voordeel als je al eens hebt gewerkt met tools zoals PowerBI, Tableau of een gedegen basis hebt in data analyse met bijvoorbeeld SPSS of Excel.

**YPublic** ontwikkelt samen met jou een carrièreplan waarin jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en groei binnen het vakgebied centraal staan. Vanaf de start van het Traineeship ga je werken bij één van onze opdrachtgevers binnen de publieke sector.

**Over ons**  
De cultuur en de bedrijfsvoering van YPublic is gericht op het ontwikkelen, inzetten en ondersteunen van specialisten binnen een uitdagende omgeving. Onze medewerkers zijn de ambassadeurs van datagedreven werken en nemen overheidsorganisaties mee in de transitie naar een nieuwe manier van werken. Middels innovatieve opleidingsconcepten worden YPublic medewerkers opgeleid om de voortrekkersrol te vervullen. Zo zijn ze in staat om een belangrijke bijdrage te leveren in het proces naar een slimme, datagedreven organisatie. Opgedane kennis delen we met elkaar, dat vinden we belangrijk. YPublic stimuleert een omgeving waarbinnen overheidsorganisaties en professionals leren van elkaars ervaringen.

Enthousiast? Dan ontvangen wij graag je sollicitatie met uitgebreid CV via onze website.

Vragen? Kijk voor meer informatie op www.ypublic.nl, www.dataprofessionalsoverheid.nl of bel met Dennis Kuis: telefoonnummer 06-53945738. YPublic is landelijk actief; vraag naar de mogelijkheden in jouw regio en solliciteer!

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Vaste baan, Detachering, Betaalde opleiding / bbl, Bepaalde tijd, Projectbasis  
Contractduur 12 maanden

Salaris: Vanaf €2.600,00 per maand

Verwacht aantal uur: 32 – 40 per week

Rooster:

* ma-vr

Secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Bedrijfsopleiding
* Pensioen
* Reiskostenvergoeding

Soorten aanvullende vergoedingen:

* Vakantiegeld

Taal:

* Nederlands (Vereist)

Toestemming om te werken:

* Netherlands (Vereist)

Werklocatie: Fysiek

title: Data Analyst - Tax
description:
Booking.com continues to develop new products (i.e. adding other travel related products to our platform), global and local tax regulations continue to change and data and tax reporting and collection obligations for platforms are becoming our new reality. Within the Tax team we see the increased compliance requirements from the Tax authorities, and an increased need for the utilisation of Data &Technology to improve the efficiency of our operations. That’s why we are looking for an additional expertise as a Data Analyst to expand our team.



As a **Tax** - **Data Analyst,** you will work for Booking.com in Amsterdam (Booking.com’s headquarters) where our entire Tax department sits. You will report directly into one of the Tax Managers. The Tax department currently consists of around 40 persons, responsible for various disciplines (CIT, TP, VAT, Tax accounting and other experts). The Tax department is part of Booking.com’s international Finance team (approx. 1000 professionals, mostly based in Amsterdam).



The role involves close interaction with our entire Tax team, our parent company (Booking Holdings Group based in Norwalk, Connecticut), our international offices, functional teams and other Finance colleagues. Therefore, it is essential that you have excellent management and communication skills in English.



Within the Tax team, the Tax Data Analyst will be the driver of how data is leveraged to comply with local and international tax regulations. With a deep practical understanding of the Tax Technology, data, workflows, methods and tooling, the Data Analyst will autonomously drive analysis and reporting within the scope of the Tax team. They can adapt their tooling and approach based on business and regulatory needs. This involves reporting, analytics, data visualization and taking ownership of workflows and support initiatives for data quality and stability, using their experience to think of scalable solutions. The role also requires someone with a problem-solving, solution driven approach and the ability to translate data problems into easy to digest language for senior members of the Tax team.



Due to the rapid changes in the organization, the tasks, and duties of this role may evolve over time. You will be keen to develop and grow within the role and to take on additional challenges and responsibilities as they occur.


**Key responsibilities**


* Works with several stakeholders and dependencies within the business to collect data that will be used for:
+ Ad-hoc analysis
+ Data reports for compliance and audit
+ Dash boarding & visualization of tax and finance metrics;
+ Supporting the decision-making process within the tax team.

* Works with various stakeholders within the Tax team to continuously improve the efficiency and accuracy of data collection and preparation.
* Uses their experience to translate business data into data stories in compliance with international & local tax regulations.
* Is able to communicate results and outcomes clearly to stakeholders based on their knowledge and experience.
* Supports in building automated processes within the Tax team with data as the main driver.


**Knowledge and skills**


* Level of Education: Bachelor degree or higher in either Finance, Mathematics, Data Science or Computer Science
* Years of relevant experience: 3-5 years

  


**Requirements of special knowledge/skills**


* Knowledge and experience with at least one data analysis language (e.g: SQL, Python, R, etc)
* Strong knowledge and experience on data analysis (e.g. intermediate-advanced level of Excel, Alteryx Certified, Tableau Prep, Knime, etc)
* Knowledge and experience using visualisation and BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Google Looker, MicroStrategy, PowerBI, etc)
* SAP S4/HANA experience preferred
* Experience with Tax engines is a plus (e.g. Avalara, Vertex, etc)
* Driven and results oriented personality
* Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance
* Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture
* Analytical and curious mindset
* Strong interpersonal skills
* Open and friendly attitude


**What we offer:**


**Benefits & Perks: Global Impact, Personal Relevance**



Booking.com’s Total Rewards Philosophy is not only about compensation but also about benefits. Our Total Rewards strive to make it easier for you to experience all that life has to offer on your terms so that you can focus on what really matters. We offer competitive compensation as well as thoughtful, valuable, and even fun benefits, which include:



Headquarters are located in one of the most dynamic and cosmopolitan cities in Europe: Amsterdam.  

Contribute to a high-scale, sophisticated, world-class product and see the real-time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide.  

Be part of a truly international, fast-paced environment with a performance-driven culture.  

Full relocation support for you and your family to move to Amsterdam. We have fine-tuned this process by successfully relocating over 300 Technology professionals to Amsterdam in the last year alone!  

Performance-based company that offers 29 vacation days, career advancement, and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  

Discount on Booking.com accommodations with the “Booking Deal,” including other perks and benefits.  

Company-sponsored family and social activities to help our employees become integrated with each other and Dutch culture.  

Diverse and creative colleagues from every corner of the world.  

Health, life, and disability insurance  

Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme, including: parent, grandparent, bereavement, and care leave.  

Hybrid working includes flexible working arrangements and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country).  

Industry-leading product discounts for yourself, friends, and family, including automatic Genius Level 3 status and quarterly Booking.com wallet credit.  

Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs, and a complimentary Headspace membership  

On-site meals, coffee, and snacks, including healthy and vegan options, are available daily\*


**#ThinkInclusion: Wellbeing & Inclusion at Booking.com:**



Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations.



Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace; it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone. Inclusion is at the heart of everything we do. It’s a place where you can make your mark and have a real impact in travel and technology.”



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustment to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.



Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.

 **Pre-****Employment****Screening:**  

  

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

title: Senior Data Analyst, Circular Ventures
description:
**Job ID:** 245949


**Date posted:** 24/06/2024


**Who you are**  

  

We are looking for a Data Analyst in our Buyback team to join us in developing new revolutionizing ways for IKEA to create a better and more circular life for hundreds of millions of customers globally.
  

  

Our diverse and global team within Data & Machine Learning is growing, and we would love to talk with you, if you recognize yourself in some of the following:  

* A strong background in Analytics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or equivalent (at least MS or equivalent)
* Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a minimum of 2 years.
* Enjoy figuring out how to use math, code and data to derive insights from large datasets in order to solve real-life, fast-paced business problems
* Ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
* Proficient in SQL and data visualization tools (preferably Power BI)
* Experience working with large datasets and databases.
* Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
* Detail-oriented with strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Experience with dbt and Google Cloud is a plus

  

On the less technical side we expect that you:  

* Are passionate about sustainability and driven to making the planet a better place for the many people!
* Have a strong business interest and want to use data to make the best decisions to grow our circular services.
* Have a positive attitude and excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Familiar with working in a cross-functional product team. We try to learn from each other’s perspectives all the time.
* Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge.

  

This is our wish list! If you don’t recognize yourself in all these points, you might still be an excellent candidate for the role. We like to think long-term and invest in people’s development together with us.  

  

**What you'll be doing day to day**  

  

You will conduct advanced data exploration and analyses that deliver insights, which support and enable data-driven decision-making for our Buyback service. Our vision is to transform into a circular business by 2030, through developing customer facing circular services for the many. Currently we have two services in our portfolio: Buyback & Resell and As-Is Online. And we are launching two new services this fiscal year: IKEA Preloved (a marketplace) and a Repair Hub. Exciting times ahead!  

  

**Our team within Ikea**  

  

You are part of the Data & Machine Learning team together with other Data Analysts and Data Engineers (and potentially Data Scientists and ML Engineers in the future). Together, you join cross-functional product teams consisting of colleagues from Engineering, Product and Design (PEDX), to design, implement and deploy products at scale. Your job is a mix of understanding business needs, designing data solutions – and of course writing code.  

  

This role is based in Amsterdam, in our Digital hub that is housing up to 500 co-workers, located in the harbour area north-west of the city centre.  

We see so many opportunities for what we can accomplish and have the ambition to be a world class team. At the same time, we believe that our work is not just about solving business problems, but also about learning and having fun together.  

  

WE CAN OFFER YOU  

* Work on some exciting problems as described above. Moreover, you are encouraged to spot new opportunities or to collaborate with Data & Machine Learning colleagues in other specialist teams.
* Opportunities to have global impact with your work, both for people and planet.
* Flexible and modern tools: we deploy on Google Cloud Platform, and we use a lot of open-source tools across the board.
* Hardware and OS of your choice.
* A team of great colleagues to learn with and from (with world-class experience across all aspects of Data Analytics).
* Continuous learning (we aim to spend 20% of our working time on learning).
* Flexible and friendly working environment.

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

Does this sound like your next challenge? IKEA offers an exciting and empowering work environment in a global workplace. And as the world’s leader in life at home, you have exceptional opportunities to grow and develop together with us.
  

  

If you have questions regarding the recruitment process, please reach out to Olivia at olivia.de.peyronnet@ingka.com. Please apply with your application in English. Motivation letters are highly appreciated. Note that we can’t process any applications through email. Thank you!
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Automation Engineer
description:
**Working at Kyocera Senco EMEA**



Kyocera Europe is the specialist in fasteners and fastening tools for construction professionals and industry. For the EMEA market we are looking for an Automation Engineer who’s responsibility is to help drive innovation and growth in the industry automation segment and to assure a positive customer experience throughout the investigation, installation and after sales process to maximize the Customer Lifetime Value.  

This newly created position will build a long term trust relationship and strategic alliance with industrial customers and external partners alike, turning them into brand ambassadors. It is a multidisciplinary role working in close cooperation with our customers and both the local and central commercial teams involved.


**Automation Engineer EMEA (32 – 40 hours)**
============================================



Location: Lelystad, Netherlands (with EMEA-wide responsibilities, work from home flexibility)


**The job**  

As an Automation Engineer EMEA you play a crucial role in the development of our European Automation business in the Fastening Industry. Together with our Category Manager Automation you will be responsible for driving innovations and developments based on a strategic or project based planning. His/her/them focus on the designing, developing and detailing of pneumatic and mechatronic systems, stand-alone as well as part of a machine or system.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* In-house innovations/adjustments on a project or strategy/funnel basis
	+ Define functional and technical specifications
	+ Produce technical designs/solutions in a structured manner/process
	+ Involvement and passion (ownership/commitment) in the development of the chosen solution, including full delivery and coordination towards production
* Translate new developments into working instructions towards production
	+ In-house production
	+ External production + development
* Maintain data/drawings in PDM system
	+ Preparation and maintenance of product documentation such as bills of materials and revision management
	+ Maintain and manage Spare parts
* Optimize internal engineering processes
	+ In Co-op with Production, Logistics and Supply chain planning
	+ Contribute to the establishment and implementation of standardization
	+ Contribute to the continuous improvement of R&D by proposing structural improvements.
* Ensure European Compliance on all Automation tools
	+ Machine directives, CE,…
* In-house testing
	+ Test in-house innovations/developments
	+ QC on new tools
* Provide External & internal training for:
	+ Production
	+ Technical service
	+ Sales
	+ Customers
* Take lead in installations where necessary
	+ Post launch validation and tracking by timely and sufficient reviews
	+ Provide second help line after service (Local or digital assistance)

**Qualifications:**


* A Bachelor degree in engineering preferably mechanical engineering, industrial automation or similar is a minimum
* Minimum of 4 years relevant experience in engineering and product development
* Knowledge of legislation and standards relating to the development of machines, such as the Machine Directive, CE or commitment to acquire this knowledge
* Strong knowledge of control systems and measurement + control technology
* Good knowledge of:
	+ Microsoft Office (excel, word, teams etc.)
	+ 3D CAD (solid works & Inventor)
	+ PDM / PLM
* Good communicative skills in English
* Confident, dynamic with a digital first mindset
* Argumentation is based on data analytics (facts & figures)
* Starts with the answer and thinks out of the box
* Takes project ownership and has a pro-active attitude
* Empathic listener to customers and co-workers
* Occasional traveling and customer visits
* Knowing our products and our industry is a big plus
* Based in the Netherlands


**What we offer**


* The possibility to join a healthy global company
* A pleasant and open working atmosphere in an informal energetic club with ditto colleagues
* The opportunity to make a positive impact on the organization and its results
* Competitive salary and benefits package such as 25 days off and profit share
* Affiliated with the CAO Technische Groothandel
* Flexibility regarding working from home
* Laptop and mobile


**How to apply?**  

Please send your CV with motivation to hr@kyocera-senco.eu. If you have any substantive questions about the position, please contact Thierry Deplee (Head Of Category Management EMEA), email: tdeplee@kyocera-senco.eu



Unsolicited services or offers from recruitment agencies or intermediaries will not be responded to
company_description: Kyocera Senco is gespecialiseerd in bevestigingsoplossingen en richt zich op innovatief gereedschap, bevestigingsmaterialen en accessoires.

title: Data analyst
description:
+ 3-5 years

+ 32 - 40 uur
+ Data

+ €70.000 - €95.000


* You will become part of the frontrunner in the energy transition, where you contribute to a more sustainable future by building on the growth and development of Eneco's integration platforms
* You know how to transform ideas into realization
* You will implement the desired Data & Analytics solution(s) that will be realized on our state of the art data platform

Why choose for Eneco?
Why choose Eneco? We want to accelerate the energy transition. With our ambitious ‘One Planet plan’, we have made it clear that by 2035, we aim to be the first energy company to become CO2-neutral. No more reliance on natural gas! The entire Netherlands is making the switch. Towards smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable energy. Everyone has their own reasons for doing so. Some want to contribute to a better climate, others switch because their neighbors are doing it, or because they find joy in saving energy, and we're doing it now!


At Eneco, we want to help everyone to take the next sustainable step. And we are looking for the best people who can make that possible. People who are enthusiastic about our mission of 'sustainable energy for everyone' and who want to further develop their talents at Eneco. We want everyone to be able to participate effortlessly in the energy transition. This can only happen if we better assist our customers, remove barriers for them to become more sustainable by listening and understanding their true needs.


Digital innovations help the market align supply and demand and make it as easy as possible for users. Data plays a crucial role in this. From the Data & Technology Services department, we are working to make Eneco a data-driven organization that bases its decisions and actions on customer, product, asset, and market data.


What you’ll do
Our Data Services department is responsible for executing data projects for the Business and fueling the growth of data capabilities by acting as an incubator for the development of data products. You have a pivotal role in multiple projects.

* You translate the requirements from the Business into data driven solutions where you'll be designing data models (e.g., Canonical, Data Vault, Data Mart) that supports these requirements.
* Activities of the Data Analyst are primarily scoped on translating data, reporting and dashboard requirements to suitable data & analytics solutions for business usage.
* The Data Analyst is a critical thinker who keeps on asking 'why' questions until it is completely clear what the Business wants to achieve.

Is this about you?* At least 5 years of relevant experience as a data or information analyst
* Strong experience with SQL.
* Deep understanding of business concepts, processes and data entities
* Solid experience with data analysis, information analysis and business/process analysis
* Extensive knowledge and experience with the application of data concepts, data models and data warehouse concepts
* Excellent communication skills and good command of the English language, spoken and written

You’ll be responsible for* Drafting and proposing business requirements and (non) functional requirements regarding required data products.
* Translates requirements into appropriate functional specifications and functional designs into Data & Analytics solutions and, where necessary, applies prototyping as a basis for business acceptance and technical implementation of the data solutions.
* Designing (logical) data models in line with Eneco's Canonical Data Model to support the realization or adjustment of the (technical) data models (Data Vault, Data Marts) in our data platform.
* Providing stakeholders with proactive advice on new or existing data solutions and, together with architecture, ensures the application of the correct solution direction.

This is where you’ll work
Data & Technology Services has multiple departments; Data Services has 3 teams – an enterprise datamanagement team, a data analytics team and a data engineer team. You will be part of the data analytics team that assist the business in using the various parts of the Enterprise Data Platform effectively to create customer and business value.


What we have to offer
Gross annual salary between €70.000 and €95.000


Including 8% holiday allowance, a good pension and parental leave.
FlexBudget on top of your gross salary


Have it paid out, use it to buy extra holiday days or save it up for something nice - it's up to you.
Personal and professional growth


Eneco is fully committed to help you in your personal and professional development.
Hybrid working, at home or in the office


You work 40% at the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide what works best for you.
Work that works for you and the climate
If you decide on a career at Eneco, you are choosing ambition, growth and opportunities. You will have all the space you want to improve yourself and do your job the way that suits you best, which includes having a good work-life balance. You can work to a flexible schedule and work partly from home if your role allows it.
That is how you can work on your own future and on the future of the world. After all, you and your 4,000 colleagues are committed to our mission: climate neutrality by 2035. We assist customers to accelerate their sustainability efforts, devise innovative solutions and seize opportunities with both hands. Are you ready?
The stages of our application procedure:


Stap 1


Your application
Stap 2


We carefully review your application
Stap 3


We invite you for a 1st (online) interview
Stap 4


Sometimes we want to get to know you even better, then there will be an online assessment and a 2nd interview
Stap 5


Yes! If it’s a match and if you agree, the recruiter will happily discuss your job offer
Want to know more about this job function?
We understand that you may want to learn more before taking the next step in your career. Therefore, we encourage you to reach out to our recruiter, Mark van Dommelen. Whether you have questions about the interview process, the specific duties and responsibilities of the role, or are simply curious about the company culture, we are here to answer all your inquiries.  

  

**For the recruitment of this position, we prefer to handle the process internally and do not wish to collaborate with external parties.**

title: Data Engineer AI&T
description:
**Bedrijfsomschrijving**  

Vind jij het leuk om analytische tools te bouwen, kun jij overweg met grote hoeveelheden data én wordt jij blij van code? Dan is dit een leuke uitdaging voor jou!


Technologie speelt een steeds grotere rol bij BDO. Om relevant en concurrerend te blijven, worden werkprocessen verder geautomatiseerd; het ‘BDO Data & technologie platform’ speelt hierin een belangrijke rol. Binnen dit data platform heeft ook het audit domein een prominente rol.


Audit is belangrijk voor de maatschappij omdat het ervoor zorgt dat bedrijven en organisaties financiële transparantie bieden en dat de financiële informatie die zij verstrekken betrouwbaar is. Dit is belangrijk voor investeerders, consumenten, aandeelhouders en andere belanghebbenden om weloverwogen beslissingen te kunnen nemen.


De audit is al een aantal jaren volop in verandering: data-analyse, data process automation en performante-rapportages zijn inmiddels onmisbaar binnen het vakgebied en de werkzaamheden van de accountant. Audit Innovation & Technology (AI&T) is het team binnen de Line of Service Audit & Assurance dat zich richt op het innoveren en ontwikkelen van hoogwaardige audit-gerelateerde producten.


Binnen dit team zijn 10 collega’s werkzaam, waarvan 7 collega’s zich bezighouden met data engineering / analyse. De andere 3 collega’s houden zich bezig met het aansturen van projecten. Als team proberen wij de brug te vormen tussen het audit domein en het technische (data) domein. Het toepassen van domeinkennis en de technische kennis is een essentiële factor voor succesvolle en bruikbare producten. Om een nog meer data- en technologie gedreven organisatie te worden, zoeken wij een Data Engineer binnen het AI&T team.

 **Vacatureomschrijving**  

Als Data Engineer werk je samen met andere analisten en accountants om de audit processen te verbeteren en te automatiseren. Binnen BDO werken wij in de Azure Stack. Je werkt hierbij met technologieën zoals Azure Data Factory en Databricks; daarin gebruiken wij programmeertalen zoals SQL en Python. Ook zul je kennis maken met Microsoft Fabric, in deze nieuwe tooling van Microsoft willen wij ons dataplatform in de toekomst onderbrengen; hierin zal de medaillon architecture leidend zijn.


Binnen de werkzaamheden wordt gebruik gemaakt van lakehouses, datawarehouses en data modellen. Met deze toepassingen zijn wij in staat om de accountant te voorzien van de analyses die ze op dat moment nodig hebben met een daar bijhorende performance.


Er is als Data Engineer ook ruimte om nieuwe technieken uit te proberen en te onderzoeken, zoals bijvoorbeeld AI toepassingen. Er is genoeg ruimte voor jouw eigen inbreng en ideeën, dit wordt erg gewaardeerd.

**Je belangrijkste taken zijn:**

* Ontwikkelen van notebooks en data pipelines
* Analyse en PowerBI dashboards maken voor onze audit collega’s
* Processen automatiseren aan de hand van beschikbare (financiële) data
* Meedenken en beslissen wat de beste keuzes zijn in onze medaillon architecture in ons platform

**Benodigde Kennis/Ervaring:**

* Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring
* Een afgeronde relevante (technische) opleiding op WO of HBO-niveau in de richting van Data / Business Analytics
* Kennis van datatools (bij voorkeur Databricks, Azure Datafactory en Power BI)
* Python (Pyspark is een pré) en SQL

**Fijne pre's:**

* Kennis van Audit
* Kennis van Fabric

**Daarnaast vragen we dat je:**

* Een teamspeler bent
* Communicatief vaardig bent
* Proactief te werk gaat
* Doorzettingsvermogen beheerst
* Dat je kwalitatief gericht te werk gaat
company_description: BDO USA, LLP is a professional services firm providing assurance, tax, and advisory services to a wide range of publicly traded and privately held companies.

title: Senior QA Engineer - CPMS (contractor)
description:
**WE ARE SHELL RECHARGE SOLUTIONS**



We're on a mission to enable cleaner transportation for everyone, driving the way towards a lower-carbon future. We do this by designing and building solutions for charging electric vehicles at home, at work, and on-the-go.

  


With some of the most passionate and experienced minds on our side, we aim to make charging easy and accessible. Our award-winning services include charge points, a mobile app, and a charge card, providing access to 600,000 charge points in over 33 countries.

  




**THIS IS HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE**


**Your core accountabilities are to...**


Be a part of engineering efforts among enthusiastic, highly capable SDET (QA) team in the Netherlands to develop and utilize best-in-industry test automation to ensure high quality feature launches for Charge Point Management System of Shell Recharge Solutions.  

+ 

  

Apply your understanding of software engineering best practices to guide the test automation team in the development of reliable and scalable automated tests at the integration, system, and user acceptance testing levels and promote test automation to our development team at the unit test level.  
+ 

  

Promote quality assurance in your team by owning the testing process and be sure quality is built in.  
+ 

  

Participate in the team by refining and estimating user stories, planning sprints, daily stand-ups and retrospectives.  
+ 

  

Support peers in QA, through workshops, documentation, and pair programming.  
+ 

  

Design and continuously improve testing process that fits the team expectations (better CI/CD capabilities, code analytics, performance test, vulnerability tests, etc.).  
+ 

  

Conduct exploratory testing sessions or leverage experience-based testing to complement automation efforts as needed.  
+ 

  
+ Own the monitoring and alerting activity on the platform providing a strong customer support interface.

 **THE PERSON WE ARE LOOKING FOR**

  

* Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Computer Science/ Engineering or equivalent work experience required.
* 7+ years’ experience with relevant hands-on test automation development.
* Good knowledge and experience with Python.
* Knowledge or learning eagerness of Golang to support debugging.
* Experience in testing micro-services, preferably using Consumer-Driven Contract Testing.
* Experience with logging and monitoring, preferably using DataDog.
* Knowledge of the mainstream technologies for highly scalable, reliable and functional back-end systems.
 **WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**

  


Working at Shell Recharge Solutions means working in a fun, fast-growing international company with big ambitions.


**By joining us, you will:**

  

* Contribute to a more sustainable future;
* Become an expert in e-mobility;
* Work in an open and diverse culture with colleagues from all over the world;
* Receive a competitive salary that fits your experience + yearly bonus;
* Receive a **work from home budget** to professionally equip your home office;
* Have 28 paid days of annual leave based on a 40 hour work week;
* Be able to spend up to 5 working days a year on **volunteering**;
* Develop your skills and expertise through several training sessions. Besides this, you will receive a **personal training budget** and set your annual goals with your personal development plan;
* Enjoy our monthly fun get-togethers (drinks), our annual winter and summer outing, and lots of other events or sport teams initiated by colleagues.

 ***Please note:*** *If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown that women and underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientation, and life experiences to apply.*
company_description: Shell Recharge Solutions is unlocking the future of mobility.

title: Senior Director, Engineering
description:
**Who we are:**


Choreograph is WPP’s global data products and technology company. We’re on a mission to transform marketing by building the fastest, most connected data platform that bridges marketing strategy to scaled activation.


We work with agencies and clients to transform the value of data by bringing together technology, data and analytics capabilities. We deliver this through the Open Media Studio, an AI-enabled media and data platform for the next era of advertising.


We’re endlessly curious. Our team of thinkers, builders, creators and problem solvers are over 1,000 strong, across 20 markets around the world.

**About choreograph create:**


Choreograph Create is WPP’s omnichannel dynamic creative optimisation (DCO) platform, enabling users to align advertising content (e.g. images, videos, copy) with data (e.g. location) in real-time, turning one creative concept into thousands of unique ads. With Create, brands can deliver relevant content across all major media channels – including websites, TV and social media platforms. We utilise AI and ML to optimize campaigns towards the best performing content with no human intervention, providing valuable insight for advertisers. Users from across WPP utilise Create to optimize content for some of the world's leading brands.

  

**About this role:**


We are looking for a delivery-focused Senior Director of Engineering to develop and lead a high-performing engineering team through a period of exponential growth. You will be responsible for delivering a modern, large-scale SaaS product for the advertising industry – one part of a wider suite of Choreograph products. You will own the delivery of product commitments whilst always looking to improve the productivity of the engineering team, across all disciplines. You must coordinate across departments to accomplish collaborative goals, ensure the engineering team has a voice in leadership discussions and nurture and encourage a positive and productive engineering culture. The advertising and media landscape is exceptionally fast-paced, and our team must be adaptable.


Your mission will be to provide hands-on leadership, fostering a culture of cross-functional collaboration and efficient delivery of business value.


**Responsibilities**

* Lead the development of a SaaS dynamic creative platform used by some of the world’s biggest brands.
* Develop strategies and new initiatives to advance on an organizational and technical level both the department and the product.
* Motivate and communicate across multiple levels of your department.
* Have successful peer partnerships with other department leaders across Choreograph and WPP.
* Provide a consistent and successful interface between engineering, product management and product design.
* Develop leadership skills within the organisation and mentor other leaders.
* Development, measurement, and management of key metrics for your team and the products performance.
* Drive high throughput.
* Standardise the development process where needed.
* Nurture a desirable and enviable engineering culture.

**Requirements**

* Experience with advertising technology (AdTech) a must, with ad serving and dynamic creative (DCO) experience highly desired.
* A demonstrated engineering leader, with experience leading a team through a period of considerable growth.
* A well-developed people management philosophy for managers and engineers.
* Experience leading a cross-functional engineering team of permanent staff and contractors.
* Understanding of how to successfully manage a team that is mostly remote, with a willingness to spend time in the office collaborating with peers.
* A strong understanding of business, business requirements and striking a balance between cost, speed, and quality in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
* Deep understanding of software development methodologies, agile practices, and project management principles.
* An advocate of architecture/software design patterns and software development best practices, able to bring your own ideas and lead the team to success.
* Good knowledge of cloud-based technologies, scalable architectures, and modern devops and sre practices.
* Experience with functional programming, especially with Clojure/Script considered a bonus.


If you are ready to be at the forefront of the AdTech industry, shaping its future, and driving success for both Choreograph and our clients, we encourage you to apply and join our team.


Choreograph is the beating heart of data inside WPP’s media investment group, GroupM, the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $60 billion in annual media investment.. Discover more about Choreograph at www.choreograph.com

**GroupM and all its affiliates embrace and celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity.****We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more great work we can create together.**

title: Lead UX Designer
description:
**WHO WE ARE**


Choreograph is WPP’s global data products and technology company. We’re on a mission to transform marketing by building the fastest, most connected data platform that bridges marketing strategy to scaled activation.
We work with agencies and clients to transform the value of data by bringing together technology, data and analytics capabilities. We deliver this through the Open Media Studio, an AI-enabled media and data platform for the next era of advertising.
We’re endlessly curious. Our team of thinkers, builders, creators and problem solvers are over 1,000 strong, across 20 markets around the world.


POSITION OVERVIEW


Do you love getting better and better at what you do? Do you thrive in an environment with a lot of change, open communication, and rapid innovations? Then maybe we will be a match!* 

Education or work experience level: HBO, University* 

Location: Sittard and/or Eindhoven  

RESPONSIBILITIES


Our self-steering teams are building a global platform that is transforming the way our users work. Our end-users are all GroupM client teams worldwide and it helps them to execute advertising campaigns more effectively and smarter. We are looking for the person who will help us make the lives of our media specialists even better.

  

You will be part of the data connections team. Together with full-stack engineers, product managers, customer success and users you will discover and deliver new functionality. You will facilitate discovery activities like user interviews, research, experience maps, design, and test prototypes and/or handle usability risks. When confronted with uncertainties, you collect and use data to make informed next steps.

  

Would you love to collaborate with teams in other countries? Are you looking for a challenge and do you have the skills to join our team? Then we are looking for you!

  

REQUIREMENTS

* You have a passion for UX principles and teaching them to others
* You have experience with data centric platforms
* You get energy from delivering full features together with your mission team
* You speak fluent Dutch and English
* You have strong communication skills
* Experience with Continuous Product Discovery is a plus

title: Lead Front End Engineer
description:
**Who we are:**


Choreograph is WPP’s global data products and technology company. We’re on a mission to transform marketing by building the fastest, most connected data platform that bridges marketing strategy to scaled activation.


We work with agencies and clients to transform the value of data by bringing together technology, data and analytics capabilities. We deliver this through the Open Media Studio, an AI-enabled media and data platform for the next era of advertising.


We’re endlessly curious. Our team of thinkers, builders, creators and problem solvers are over 1,000 strong, across 20 markets around the world.

**About choreograph create:**


Choreograph Create is WPP’s omnichannel dynamic creative optimisation (DCO) platform, enabling users to align advertising content (e.g. images, videos, copy) with data (e.g. location) in real-time, turning one creative concept into thousands of unique ads. With Create, brands can deliver relevant content across all major media channels – including websites, TV and social media platforms. We utilise AI and ML to optimize campaigns towards the best performing content with no human intervention, providing valuable insight for advertisers. Users from across WPP utilise Create to optimize content for some of the world's leading brands.

 **About this role:**


As the lead front-end developer for Choreograph Create, you will both contribute to and oversees the development of a responsive, user-friendly SaaS web application, utilizing the latest web technologies and frameworks, guiding the team in FE coding and architectural decisions. The lead ensures that the team adheres to modern development practices and effectively utilizes tools to achieve optimal performance and user experience.
