title: Data Analyst
description:
Tiqets is an award-winning tech scale-up headquartered in the Netherlands. We are hiring a Data Analyst to join our mission to bring the world more ways to culture!



Full-time · Amsterdam


Who are we?



We are revolutionising the way people buy tickets to culture and attractions all over the world. Our technology lets users easily book tickets to the best attractions in seconds, meaning customers can enter museums, zoos, theme parks, and more faster than ever.



We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.



These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, content, and product.



If you want to join our team, working as a Data Analyst, send us your CV. We might be looking for YOU!


**Our values**


* We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
* We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
* We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!

  


**What you will do**



The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Senior Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.



You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.



If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.


**Responsibilities**


* Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
* Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
* Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
* Work with Product Managers, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
* Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
* Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
* Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
* Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework


**Qualifications**


* Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
* 3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
* **Experience with DBT**.
* Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
* Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
* Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
* Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing

  


Perks & Benefits at Tiqets
* Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
* Bright, welcoming office located in the center of Amsterdam
* Opportunity to make an impact in the fastest growing tech scale-up
* 20% personal Tiqets discount code to explore great museums/venues worldwide
* Tiqets learning academy: group & individual learning
* Tuesday's Pizza & beer sessions


* Friday drinks
* Sports activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing and more
* Pension scheme and travel compensation
* Everyone - employed at Tiqets will receive a monthly internet allowance for working from home
* Everyone - employed at Tiqets can reimburse home work space necessities
* Hybrid working model


Our Data Analytics Stack
DBT

  


Looker



Databricks



Airflow


Follow us on Instagram
company_description: Tiqets is an online ticketing platform for museums and attractions that connects travelers worldwide with more ways to experience culture.

title: IT Chapter Lead - Cards
description:
As an IT Chapter Lead, you will play a critical role in building and improving our platforms for Cards NL, leveraging your expertise in both development and operations. At ING, we work collaboratively in multi-disciplinary teams using Scrum, Agile, and DevOps principles, with a focus on end-to-end ownership of customer journeys and products.


We believe that diversity and inclusivity are key to our success as a team, and we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, age, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic.


In this role, you will be a senior IT engineer who sets an example for the team, shares knowledge, drives innovation, and delivers results as a member of a squad. Additionally, you will be an important member of the Tribe's leadership team.


Together with the IT Area Lead and other Chapter Leads a vision is developed and executed to inspire engineers to grow and drive technological innovation. Managing your chapter means enabling our engineers to grow their mastery and to develop themselves through continuous on-the-job coaching, 1:1 conversations, creating a development plan and monitoring it together. Finding the true purpose of your engineers and enabling them to grow in what they are passionate about and excel in finding that win-win situation for the engineer and ING. Sixty percent of your time, you work as a senior engineer. You use your seniority to maximize team performance. You will be the differentiating factor to ensure continuity while moving the chapter to ING standards and push innovation and continuous improvements in an environment where you have the possibility to show your work on platforms with high impact for our customers.


The people in your chapter are equally ambitious as you, and you like to transfer your expertise to them and feel satisfaction from coaching (both professionally as personally) less senior chapter members. We work in an international environment with some teams offshore. You are ambitious and want to achieve. You stimulate your Chapter members towards continuous improvement of their skills.


Focus is on ensuring operational availability of services to the customers next to compliancy to IT Risk Controls (including audits), using consistent software delivery through environments (DTAP). As this area is going through a time of many developments and changes, it is a dynamic area in which there is lots of opportunity to learn, grow and excel.

**Key responsibilities**

* Identify and fulfil IT knowledge gaps within your chapter ensuring that your chapter is qualitatively properly staffed
* Continuously work on skills improvements, expertise and personal growth of your IT engineers
* Ensure quality and ownership for work delivered via sprints, set and improve standards according to the agile way of working
* Leading role in processes and decisions which are strategic for your chapter, such as the vendor selection, technology selection, offshore strategies
* Align with IT vendors, ING Infra departments and the end users
* Line management tasks such as hiring new employees, assess performance of current employees
* Together with your Engineers: end-responsible for keeping your IT environment up and running, healthy, secure, documented, and standardize where possible
* Together with the Product Leads, you balance team development, delivery and timelines  

Member of Tribe Leadership team  

How to succeed
* We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.


Do you love to inspire other people to grow? Are you a motivated engineer who likes to work on complex IT solutions? And although you are an experienced engineer, do you continuously want to grow your personal skills as an engineer and as a leader? Is ‘keep doing things smarter’ part of your DNA? Do you have the mentality that aligns with our culture where you ‘take it on and make it happen’? Are you someone who takes ownership and who can give other engineers a lot of energy? And constantly looking for improvements? Than you might be the person we are looking for!

**Your backpack ideally contains:**


A master’s degree in Software Engineering  

Proven track record and proficiency in software development (8 + years): backend or front end (and thorough knowledge of the other, you are expected to be able to work on front- and backend).

  

Experience and thorough understanding of (test) automation, continuous delivery, deployment tools and pipelines. We are moving towards pure DevOps profiles, so you are expected to refine, code, test and deploy your own work on our on-premise and cloud environments. An itch and self-motivation for solving technical and functional challenges. Great analytical skills and conceptual / architectural understanding, ability to quickly understand new technical concepts that are outside of your comfort zone. Strong interest and vision in recent trends in software development and technology in general.

  

We expect the ability to transfer knowledge back to the ING Bank by holding presentations, workshops, documentation and most important: setting new standards for the ways we do tech.


This are the competences what we are looking for in the Chapter Lead:

* Strong social and communication skills
* Being a sparring partner for our business colleagues
* IT Risk awareness, understanding of security concepts in software development
* Hands-on and pro-active attitude
* Fluent in English

**How to Succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you'll stay curious, keep learning, and take on responsibility. In return, we'll support you in developing into an even more awesome version of yourself.


We are looking for candidates with:

* A track record of entrepreneurship in developing strategies and rolling out services within complex stakeholder environments.
* Deep experience and knowledge in Data Management, Analytics, and Data Platforms.
* A strong background in IT is highly preferred.
* Excellent communication skills at all levels, with the ability to translate complex solutions into clear benefits and requirements.
* Strong resilience and the ability to navigate through ambiguity.

**Rewards & Benefits**


We want to make sure that it's possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm


The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience.
* 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract.
* Pension scheme.
* 13th-month salary.
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary.
* 8% Holiday payment.
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation.
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities.
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues.

**About Us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what's possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer's interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse, and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Cloud engineer
description:
Uren per week **32-36 uur**
  

Plaatsingdatum **21-06-2024**
  

Vacaturenummer **CA10043479**
  

Werk- en denkniveau **HBO**
  

Salarisniveau **€ 4.211,- tot € 5.997,-**
  

Sluitingsdatum **07-07-2024**
  

Aantal fte **1**
  
* Als Cloud engineer bij de gemeente Amsterdam draag je bij aan de verdere ontwikkeling van een innovatieve, duurzame en digitaal gestuurde stad.
* Je speelt een cruciale rol in het beheren en optimaliseren van ons dataplatform en maakt zo directe impact op het leven van Amsterdammers.
* Met een gedreven team van 11 personen bestaande uit DevOps-engineers, een scrum master, een product owner en een business analist werk je aan het waarborgen van de betrouwbaarheid, veiligheid en schaalbaarheid van onze Cloud-infrastructuur.

**De functie**
--------------


Amsterdam digitaliseert steeds verder, en onze ambities zijn hierin groot. Want wij kunnen immers met behulp van technologie het leven in onze stad verbeteren en gemakkelijker maken. Zo lossen wij stedelijke uitdagingen op die direct impact hebben op onze inwoners. Denk daarbij bij voorbeeld aan het inzetten van data bij grote Amsterdamse opgaven, zoals de overgang van aardgas naar alternatieve brandstoffen, de toenemende drukte in de stad of bij de armoedebestrijding. Maar ook het toegankelijker maken van onze diensten voor burgers, bezoekers, onze collega’s of ondernemers. Als onze nieuwe cloud engineer sta je hier midden in en werk je mee aan projecten met een grote maatschappelijke impact vanuit een team dat zich inzet voor een betere en duurzamere Amsterdam.



Bij de gemeente Amsterdam werken we aan aan een betere stad voor iedereen. Als cloud engineer versterk je onze vakgroep softwareontwikkeling, die bestaat uit 120 professionals. Hier werken we met verschillende teams, bestaande uit onder andere cloud engineers, softwareontwikkelaars, datascientists en product owners. Dit realiseren we met ontwikkelteams die ieder hun eigen producten ontwikkelen en beheren, in dit geval team AI & Data Analytics (AIDA) dat werkt aan digitale oplossingen voor de onderzoekers van de stad. Ons dataplatform bouwt aan duurzame oplossingen voor onze burgers en medewerkers in de Azure Cloud. We werken aan vooruitstrevende projecten in de stad, en denken na over hoe we AI en andere diensten in de cloud op een ethische, groene en efficiënte manier inzetten - zodat ons werk de hele stad en haar burgers ten goede komt.



Als onze nieuwe cloud engineer help je mee aan uiteenlopende uitdagingen en projecten. Momenteel werken we oa aan een project gericht op ChatGPT voor gemeentemedewerkers. Daarbij ontwikkelt het team een op ChatGPT-gebaseerde chatbot die medewerkers helpt bij het beantwoorden van vragen en het vinden van informatie binnen onze systemen. Ook werken we aan een platform voor Postgres/PowerBI/AML, waarbij we verschillende diensten in Azure leveren, denk aan een postgres database, Azure Machine Learning, en PowerBI omop een slimme, veilige en snelle manier data te visualiseren, te verwerken en op te slaan. Of werken we aan een hackathon: hoe host je een groene ChatGPT-achtige applicatie? We weten wat de ecologische voetafdruk is van software en applicaties die in de cloud worden gehost en verminderen waar dat kan. Daarom heeft het team de Amsterdam Eco Challenge georganiseerd: een hackathon met de focus op het ontwikkelen van een duurzame applicatie in de Azure cloud.


Dit doe je op een gemiddelde dag
--------------------------------

* Samen sta je sterker: je start je dag vaak met een stand-up meeting waarin je samen met je team de voortgang bespreekt en taken voor de dag verdeelt. Zo werk je werkt nauw samen met datascientists, data-engineers en het cloud team
* Ontwerpen en beheren van cloud-infrastructuur: vervolgens werk je aan het maken van een ARM template om resources te deployen in onze Azure omgeving. Je bent voortdurend bezig met het automatiseren van platformwerkzaamheden door middel van Infrastructure as Code (IaC) en CI/CD-pipelines.
* Beveiliging en naleving: je hebt een meeting met Risk over het waarborgen van de beveiliging van onze systemen en het naleven van regelgeving - een belangrijk onderdeel van je werk. Je zorgt er zo voor dat onze cloud-infrastructuur voldoet aan de hoogste veiligheidsstandaarden en werkt volgens de DevSecOps-principes.
* Continu leren en ontwikkelen: In de middag kies je een onderwerp om meer over te leren, om zo nieuwe vaardigheden en technologieën te verkennen. Elke sprint krijg je een dagdeel om te besteden aan training of het bijwonen van een workshop, zodat je altijd op de hoogte blijft van de nieuwste ontwikkelingen.


Hier ga je aan de slag
----------------------

We willen een goede werkgever zijn die ervoor zorgt dat alle collega’s zich gezien en gewaardeerd voelen. We koesteren verschillen tussen collega’s, al die verschillen zorgen voor betere resultaten voor onze organisatie én onze stad. We streven daarbij naar een personeelsbestand dat een afspiegeling is van de beroepsbevolking van Amsterdam. Dus wie jij ook bent: bij ons ben je van harte welkom!

**Digitalisering bij gemeente Amsterdam**


Amsterdam is een unieke stad. Aantrekkelijk om te wonen, werken en studeren en toonaangevend als dynamische internationale metropool. Tegelijkertijd staat de stad voor een grote uitdaging. De snelle verandering van onze samenleving leidt tot nieuwe opgaven voor de stad. Vaak hebben die opgaven digitaliseringsvraagstukken waarvoor softwareontwikkeling nodig is. De stad werkt opgavegericht met multidisciplinaire (DevOps) ontwikkelteams. Deze teams werken aan algemene voorzieningen zoals een dataplatform, App framework en componenten bibliotheek. Maar ook aan applicaties die collega’s en burgers ondersteunen. De applicaties die jij ontwikkelt hebben een groot bereik en maatschappelijke impact op de stad.

**Vakgroep Softwareontwikkeling**


De vakgroep softwareontwikkeling bestaat uit 120 professionals en levert mensen en kennis aan ontwikkelteams in de stad. De vakgroep zorgt voor ontwikkelstandaarden, stimuleert samenwerking middels gildes en faciliteert hergebruik van code middels generieke componenten. De vakgroep is onderdeel van de directie Digitale Voorzieningen binnen de IT-organisatie (DII) van de stad. Deze directie draagt zorg voor het ontwikkelen en beheren van kwalitatief hoogstaande digitale diensten.


Dit breng je mee
----------------

**Voor deze functie Cloud engineer beschik je over:**

* HBO/WO werk -en denkniveau, een opleiding op het gebied van informatica is een pre.
* Minimaal drie jaar professionele ervaring als platform engineer in een agile team
* Bekendheid met infrastructuurconcepten, zoals containerisatie en IaC, en met Microsoft Azure Cloud services en oplossingen, zoals Azure Networking.
* Ervaring met geautomatiseerde deployments door middel van CI/CD pipelines

**Aan competenties breng je mee:**

* Zelfontwikkeling: Inzicht verwerven in de eigen identiteit, waarden, sterke en zwakke kanten, interesse en en ambities en op basis hiervan acties ondernemen om competenties zo nodig verder te ontwikkelen.
* Samenwerken: Levert een constructieve bijdrage aan een gezamenlijk resultaat, in het bijzonder aan de sfeer en de relaties binnen de groep of het team.
* Integriteit: Zich houden aan de normen, waarden en omgangsregels die gelden voor de functie en voor de cultuur waarin men werkt; niet vatbaar zijn voor frauduleuze handelingen.
* Resultaatgerichtheid: Concrete doelen als uitgangspunt nemen voor het eigen gedrag en hieraan vasthouden totdat het doel bereikt is.


Dit bieden we jou
-----------------

Als Cloud engineer kom je ons 36 uur per week versterken en kun je rekenen op onderstaande arbeidsvoorwaarden.

* Een bruto maandsalaris van € 4.211,- tot € 5.997,- (schaal 11) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek. Het exacte salaris wordt afgestemd op de opleiding, kennis en ervaring die je meebrengt.
* Een arbeidsovereenkomst voor de duur van 1 jaar, met daarna de mogelijkheid op een overeenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd indien je op dit moment nog geen, of een tijdelijke, arbeidsovereenkomst hebt bij Gemeente Amsterdam.
* Indien je al een arbeidsovereenkomst voor onbepaalde tijd hebt bij de Gemeente Amsterdam, dan behoud je deze en word je overgeplaatst.
* Ontwikkel- en opleidingsmogelijkheden. Ons interne opleidingscentrum, de Amsterdamse School, biedt verschillende opleidingen, ontwikkeltrajecten en begeleiding in het werk waardoor je jezelf kan blijven uitdagen.
* Een individueel keuzebudget (IKB) van 17,05% van jouw salaris dat je kunt gebruiken voor bijvoorbeeld extra pensioenopbouw of extra verlofdagen.
* Een pensioenregeling bij ABP, het pensioenfonds voor overheid en onderwijs.
* Een reiskostenvergoeding van € 0,10 per kilometer voor reizen met de auto, € 0,15 per kilometer voor reizen met de fiets en € 0,21 per kilometer voor reizen met het OV. Dit geldt tot 45 kilometer enkele reis woon-werkafstand en voor het aantal dagen dat je op kantoor werkt.
* Een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 3,- netto per werkdag dat je thuis werkt.
* Een maandelijkse bijdrage in de ziektekostenverzekering.
* Hybride werken: in deze functie kun je deels thuis en deels op kantoor werken. We bieden (thuis)werkmiddelen aan om je werkplek veilig en gezond in te richten.
* Een mobiele telefoon en een laptop.
* Een (elektrische) leenfiets waarmee je duurzaam en gezond tussen werklocaties reist.


Nieuwsgierig naar al onze arbeidsvoorwaarden? Bekijk de Personeelsregelingen Gemeente Amsterdam (PGA).


Solliciteren naar deze baan
---------------------------

* Spreekt deze vacature je aan, dan ontvangen we jouw sollicitatie graag **uiterlijk zondag 7 juli** via de ‘direct solliciteren’ button.
* Deze vacature staat gelijktijdig intern en extern uit. Medewerkers van de gemeente Amsterdam hebben voorrang in de procedure.
* Wij ontvangen graag je motivatie, waarin je in maximaal 1 A4 pagina toelicht waarom jouw werkervaring en competenties aansluiten bij deze functie. Je motivatie wordt meegewogen tijdens de selectieprocedure.
* De selectieprocedure bestaat uit een cv/brief ronde en twee selectiegesprekken. We hebben een selectiecommissie van 4 personen samengesteld, bestaande uit een leidinggevende, een recruiter en/of PO Adviseur en twee directe collega's met wie je zult samenwerken.
* Sluit jouw cv aan bij de functie-eisen, dan nodigen we je graag uit voor een sollicitatiegesprek.
* De gesprekken vinden fysiek plaats op onze kantoorlocatie aan de Oudezijds voorburgwal 300 te Amsterdam.
* Van elke collega die ons komt versterken vragen wij een recente Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG).

*Ongevraagde acquisitie door bemiddelingsbureaus stellen we niet op prijs en kan leiden tot uitsluiting bij onze andere wervingsacties. Ook het ongevraagd sturen van cv’s door bureaus aan onze medewerkers zien we als acquisitie. Deze cv’s nemen we niet in behandeling.*

title: Software Engineer (Back-End) | Talent Program
description:
**Let’s talk talent**  
You have talent. Ready to make impact. We know. We also know that making impact starts with that first contact between likeminded people who have the same drive to shape their future. We see you, with your skills, personality and dreams. Now let’s take it to even greater heights by means of one of our talent programs for master’s and PhD graduates.

We are Mploy Associates, a talent focused consultancy firm ready to make not only our clients’ teams successful but also you. Your talent, our focus.

**More specifically?**  
We are a consultancy firm specialized in the areas of data, finance, and analytics and work on a variety of projects like investment analyses, data engineering, quant modelling and much more. Our clients are banks, insurance companies, asset managers and we are still expanding.

We help our clients build successful teams by providing the right skills, talents and know-how at the right place and time and develop ourselves continuously to stay successful. We believe that investing in talent through proven methods always pays out. Today we are proud to say that we are an international driven company with more than 100 people and many top-tier clients who share the same vision.

**How do you fit into this vision?**  
You will work as a Back-End Software Engineer for one of our clients with a special focus on your own development through one of our Talent Programs. Our Talent Programs are designed to accelerate your career from entry level to medior+ level within 24 months. By means of certified training courses, coaching and intervision sessions our employees follow an above average steep career curve. Successful graduation in our Talent Programs usually results in a permanent medior+ or senior position at one of our clients or where it becomes your responsibility to keep the team successful.

**Your activities as a Back-End Software Engineer**

Developing data pipelines and warehouses, configuring application environments and improving existing time-critical processes with a focus on continuous integration (CI) and continuous delivery (CD) are on the core of this position. Your day-to-day responsibilities include:

* Aligning with business analysts for backlog refinements;
* ·Investigation of current implementations and solutions and improving these to new standards;
* Designing, developing and testing innovative solutions in a variety of coding languages;
* Implementation of future proof security standards;
* Improving and expanding CD/CI pipelines by enhancing automated testing methods.

On average you work 36 hours a week on a client project and you spend 4 hours a week on your own personal, professional and technical development in one of our Talent Programs.

**What are we looking for?**  
We are looking for graduates with different IT related backgrounds, experiences, and passions. It speaks for itself that you are ambitious, self-reflective and dare to be confident in an authentic way.

Furthermore, you are energized by stakeholder management and are well adept at gathering reliable information. You use this in combination with a consultive mindset to make our clients more successful. Last but not least, you are eager to develop yourself on personal, professional and technical level with our personalized in-house Talent Programs. To make it more specific:

* You have 0-3 years of work experience and want to learn everything about back-end software engineering;
* You want to put the skills into practice that you have acquired during your bachelor's or master’s in Computer Science or another IT related study;
* You have good knowledge of the design and development of back-end components (e.g. REST APIs, integrations, micro-services);
* You are familiar with one or more general operating systems (e.g. Linux, Unix, Windows), cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and common programming languages (e.g., Java, SQL, Python, C#);
* You are able to troubleshoot complex software and hardware issues;
* You know your way around databases and network security systems.

**What do we offer?**  
We offer the opportunity to become an expert in software engineering in an environment where we train you to excel as a high-end professional. In addition, good working conditions are equally as important to us.

By offering free lunch at the office and regular fun team activities like escape rooms and fun dinners, we ensure a connected and social workplace. Also important; we will provide you with a public transport card and/or (electric) bike. All on us of course. Furthermore:

* A salary of €3,616 for bachelor’s and master's graduates, including holiday allowance and 13th month salary;
* Challenging work and projects for one of our top 200 clients;
* 25 days of paid annual leave;
* Half-day a week in-house professional and technical training combined with personal coaching;
* Besides in-house training opportunities, an external development budget of €2,000 per year to obtain relevant certifications as FRM or CFA;
* An international working environment with driven and ambitious colleagues from all over the world;
* The opportunity to take your next career move as a medior at the client or Mploy Associates after successfully completing your development program;
* Pro bono technical projects at socially relevant NGOs.

**Interested?**  
For more information about our different positions and Talent Programs you can visit our website www.mployassociates.com. Want to know more about the vacancy? Use the apply button above or send us an email from the moment you start your master’s so we can help you prepare for your dream career. We will be in touch.

Please note that unfortunately there is no point in applying when you do not live in the Netherlands or if you have more than 3 years of work experience. These applications will not be processed.

Are you interested in multiple positions at Mploy Associates? Apply for one position and mention the other position(s) in your motivation message. Together we will find the best match for you.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From €3.600,00 per month

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations?
* Are you living in the Netherlands?
* Are you fulltime available?
* Do you have less than three years of relevant work experience?

Education:

* Master's (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Work authorization:

* Netherlands (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 3512 LP Utrecht

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
**Job description**
-------------------



Vio.com believes travel is the one thing that opens minds to new ideas, cultures, and ways of thinking. Our mission is to **GET EVERY TRAVELLER THE BEST ACCOMMODATION DEAL, WORLDWIDE.** From adventure travel and backpacking to honeymoons and family vacations, we genuinely care so that every traveler can make the best-informed accommodation choice at the absolute best conditions for every trip.



A core strategy for achieving this mission is growing our accommodation supply and managing it more effectively than anyone else in the industry. Doing that ensures we can provide our users with access to the best available deals, which often cannot be found anywhere else.



We are looking for a **Solutions Engineer** to join Vio.com 's supply team and take a key role in implementing our Supply strategy by owning and leading our supply partners' integration and technical operation. We are working with dozens of supply partners and plan to double this amount within a year. To do it, we must master the onboarding efficiency, improve or management and optimization processes, and build internal tools to manage partners in scale.

  


**What you will do:**


* Manage supply partners' integration projects end-to-end. This requires careful coordination across multiple teams and specific knowledge of Vio's internal systems. You will work to ensure that ongoing integration projects are managed correctly and delivered in high quality and on time.
* Own the day-to-day partner's operation to improve operational KPIs and business performance. This involves core optimizations such as accurately mapping supplier data structures with Vio's own data models or keeping up to date with supplier API upgrades, but also complex integration aspects related to requests consumption and rate distribution rules.
* Lead integration maintenance and growth and push for improving their quality and robustness.
* Works relentlessly to improve our operation efficiency. Discover new needs, define and implement new processes, and define requirements of new tools.
* Maintain ongoing technical communication with partners and support in growing their relationships.
* Be the owner and authority of everything related to supply integrations and the main leader of their execution. Prioritize tasks and initiatives within your domain and support our Head of Supply in defining the strategy and roadmap.
* Collaborate closely with product, engineering, business, analytics, and leadership stakeholders to achieve the above.
* Get your hands dirty; you're expected to be very hands-on. For example, you should expect to dive deep into API docs, run analytical queries in our data warehouse daily, and look into logs, QA integration, bugs, and more.

**Who you are:**


* 5+ years experience in the the tech industry, previous experience working as a Technical Product Owner/Manager, Technical/Engineering Project Manager, or similar role in high-performing teams.
* You have a solid technical background. Preferably, you have a BSc or MSc in Science, Engineering, or another technical field or have previous experience as a developer/engineer.
* You can quickly understand technical documentation and, in particular, have a good understanding of API development methodologies and technologies.
* Excelent project management skills. A previous experience managing complex technical projects with many technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Strong analytical skills and a data-driven approach to prioritization. You justify your decisions with data as much as possible, but you are not paralyzed when data is scarce or inaccurate. You have a strong bias towards action.
* Exceptional collaboration and communication skills. You can collaborate and communicate, in written and verbal, as effectively with your technical team as with business stakeholders and external partners.
* Passion for solving problems and optimizing for efficiency and the ability to translate those solutions into requirements that your team can execute.
* Good commercial mindset. You don't focus on activities but on outcomes. What drives you is to make more happy customers book better deals and achieve a commercial impact.
* Great sense of ownership and a can-do approach, and you are an executor in your sole.

**Why join us now?**

  


* We are one of the fastest-growing accommodation booking platforms in the world today, having grown our bookings 30x between 2017 and 2022, and catering to the needs of over 100 million unique visitors worldwide each year. We do that by harnessing the power of advanced algorithms and an innovative suite of power features and managed to overcome the corona crisis remarkably fast;
* The mobile applications (iOS and Android) we launched in 2023 are already a big success in the US, and we are aiming at 10M global app installs by the end of 2024, as we are beginning to build Vio.com as the brand for value-seeking travellers worldwide;
* We are a passionate and diverse team of tech enthusiasts and creatives with a commitment and focus on the traveler above all else - and it shows in our industry-leading TrustPilot score;
* We place huge importance on rewarding our employees for the value they generate by giving Stock Appreciation Rights to all employees.

  




Do you want to know if Vio.com is the right place for you? Find out by reading about the attitude that thrives at Vio.com.

  


**What we offer:**


* Plenty of chances to learn and grow within an open, diverse culture which promotes knowledge sharing, trust and transparency;
* A great compensation package, perks and benefits (including significant stock appreciation rights);
* Flexible time off (take as many holidays as you need) and a chance to work remotely;
* You will be part of a highly international team that enjoys working, eating and playing together in one of the best office locations in Amsterdam;
* We value good food and offer catered lunches from various cuisines, great coffee, ice-cream in the fridge and the occasional barbecue in our garden;
* We enjoy getting together to celebrate our wins with company events in Amsterdam and abroad;
* A budget for your dream home office;
* Access to free mental health support via OpenUp.

  




***We encourage people from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, ages and abilities to apply. If this job description resonates with you, we want to hear from you!***


**Blog posts worth reading (add appropriate links that relate to the role)**


* Our Core Values and What they Mean to our People
* The Hiring Process at Vio.com
* Our Rebrand

  




Follow us on Instagram to see what life at Vio.com looks like!

title: Senior Data Engineer - Amsterdam
description:
Powerful Placements is a recruitment agency dedicated to connecting top talent with leading organisations. We are currently seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Engineer for our client based in Amsterdam, NL. This is a hybrid position with occasional on-site work.

**Role Overview:**

As a Senior Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in designing, developing, and optimising data pipelines and infrastructure. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless data integration, transformation, and availability for business intelligence and analytics purposes.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines.
* Develop and optimize data architecture to support business requirements.
* Implement data integration solutions for diverse data sources.
* Ensure data quality and integrity through robust validation processes.
* Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to support data-driven decision-making.
* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues.
* Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering.

**Requirements:**

* 5+ years of experience in Data Engineering
* Experience with batch processing and stream processing.
* Strong proficiency in SQL and database management.
* Experience with data warehousing solutions such as Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, or Snowflake.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
* Familiarity with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, and Kafka.
* Experience with ETL tools like Apache NiFi, Talend, or Informatica.
* Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure).
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and collaboration abilities.
* Dutch speaking is a significant advantage.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Hybrid remote in 1011 KM Amsterdam Centrum

title: Application Engineer BI/Analytics
description:
Are you looking for an international oriented and dynamic organization where you will be involved in continuous development of our data-analytics and reporting in SAP based applications? And where you will have plenty of career options? We offer a challenging career step for an IT professional.  


**Questions about this job?**
Rick van Gool, Corporate Recruiter  

M +31 6 257 00 897 or E: rick.vangool@cpp.canon  


**Application Engineer Business Intelligence/Analytics**  

**40 hours per week, hybrid in Venlo (NL)**  


**What You’ll Do**
As Application Engineer BI/Analytics you will work on maintaining and managing SAP-based applications in particular for the purpose of data analysis and reporting.  

You ensure optimal alignment of this application portfolio with the functional requirements of the users. You identify user requirements, incorporate these in a functional/technical design, realize and implement the proposed solutions. You are a sparring partner for the business regarding analytics and reporting.  


Together with your colleagues, you contribute to the development of the working methods in the team.  

**Who you’ll work with**
You’ll be working closely with the business process experts of our internal customers and your direct colleagues within your own team as well as with colleagues from other ICS departments and other sites. The processes are mainly used at two production sites: Venlo in the Netherlands and Poing in Germany. Communication with the SAP users in Germany is mostly virtual via Teams (in English), but sometimes travel will be necessary.  


**What you'll bring**
We are looking for an ambitious IT support professional who wants to excel in SAP. You have strong analytical skills, are persuasive, stress resistant and you have an interest in financial and logistical processes. Furthermore, you meet the following requirements:  


* Bachelor degree in Technical Computing or Industrial Automation
* 3-10 years of experience with software development in an ERP or business intelligence environment, but we are also open to more junior candidates
* You are customer-oriented, quality conscious, and see a challenge in preventing problems
* You have good communication skills and an excellent command of the Dutch and English languages, both verbally and in writing


Our ideal candidate is familiar with ERP/reporting applications (preferably SAP ERP and/or SAP BW), and has experience with managing software development projects and change management processes (Prince 2).  


**What You’ll Get From Us**
We offer a challenging position, in which you can combine your technical as well as your social skills to reach your goals. In a dynamic environment, you will work together with customers and stakeholders within Canon Production Printing and the total Canon group worldwide.  


Besides a challenging working environment you will receive an interesting package of employment conditions:  


* a competitive salary (range €4.000 - € 5.175 based on education and experience)
* 38 vacation days
* extra 13th Month pay (8,6%), Holiday Allowance (8%) and commuting allowance
* hybrid working for a healthy work-life balance: the opportunity to work 50% at the office and 50% from home
* a huge range of training and professional development opportunities

  


**About Canon Production Printing**  

Canon Production Printing develops and manufactures high-tech printing products and workflow software for the commercial printing market and is part of Canon, a global provider of imaging technologies and services. Canon Production Printing operates on three continents, with approximately 3300 employees (end 2022) and has its global headquarters in Venlo, the Netherlands.

title: Chief Data Officer (CDO) EMEA Global Blackbelt
description:
The Data and AI team acts as trusted advisors and expertise in Data Modernization, Analytics and AI. We work with customers to leverage data to help them achieve their business priorities and help guide customers’ journey through Analytics-led Azure Data transformation. We also support customers in evaluating their applications and business requirements, recommend solutions that meet their requirements, and demonstrate these solutions to win the business and technical decision.  

  

The CDO for EMEA is a senior role within our enterprise sales organization. They develop lasting senior customer relationships, providing ongoing advice to strengthen ties and preempt competitive challenges, extending Microsoft's opportunities through alignment with customer priorities.  

They will drive large transformative D&AI pursuits to capture the breadth of the entire Microsoft Data and AI portfolio by understanding customer business priorities and help advise transformation with MSFT products  

  

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.**Responsibilities**
--------------------

  

* Drive large transformative D&AI pursuits to capture the breadth of the entire Microsoft Data and AI portfolio by understanding customer business priorities and help advise transformation with MSFT products.
* Identify and work with appropriate regional sales leaders to prioritize key customers and engagements.
* Partner with SPT to ensure that Data and AI composition of MACC is achieved.
* Initiate early-stage executive engagement in top accounts to define data strategy.
* Mobilize specialized Global Black Belts (GBBs) and teams for tailored support.
* Champion large-scale AI pursuits that model the convergence of Data and AI capabilities within the Microsoft portfolio to drive business outcomes.
* Proactively shape the Data & AI narrative within top compete accounts to highlight Microsoft’s unique value proposition over competitors.
* Develop longer-term senior customer relationships to shape and influence customer strategy and innovation, providing ongoing advice to preempt competitive challenges, while aligning with customer business priorities to extend Microsoft's opportunity in engaged accounts (Land and expand).
* Advocate for executive customer voice to GTM and Engineering, accelerating repeatable business from landmark wins.
* Participate in both Microsoft and external CDO events to nurture and expand professional relationships

**Qualifications**
------------------

 **Minimum / Required Qualifications:*** Extensive experience in sales / sales management driving large-scale data and AI initiatives.
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to engage executives and mobilize specialized teams.
* Experience in developing and nurturing senior customer relationships.
* Ability to shape and influence customer strategy and innovation with a deep understanding of Microsoft's Data & AI capabilities.

 **Preferred:*** Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience preferred.
* Active participation in CDO communities and thought leadership events

 **Optional:** **Professional*** **Executive Presence.** Leadership and confidence required to challenge customer status quo. Demonstrated experience and expertise selling to senior business decision makers by aligning & reinforcing the value of the solution to the customer’s overall business pain and/or strategic opportunities and decision criteria.
* **Collaborative.** Ability to orchestrate and influence virtual teams to pursue sales opportunities and lead v-teams through influence. Develop and execute a territory sales and success plan, in partnership with Infra and DATA & AI Specialists, Customer Engineers, to reach and educate new developers, support pre-sales opportunities, and engage solution partners in your accounts.
* **Technical Acumen.** Formulating Data Strategy, Designing Complex Data Solutions, Data Governance.
* **Trusted advisor.** Deep understanding of key competitive technologies and/or specific industries. The ability to articulate the advantages of Microsoft technologies to C-Level and senior business decision makers. Execute a solution sales process that adds value to customers through commercial teaching to win the business and establish yourself as a trusted advisor.

 **Technical*** **Technical passion.** Passion for and experience with Data, Analytics and AI, architecture designs and technology management. Experience with one or more of the following: **preferred**
	+ Data and Analytics Platforms on public clouds and/or Azure such as Databricks, Synapse, Fabric, Snowflake or Big Query.
	+ Scalable architectures using Azure App Service, API management, serverless technologies, container orchestration (e.g., AKS, Kubernetes, Red Hat OpenShift etc.), microservice frameworks etc.
	+ Software development practices like DevOps and CI/CD tool chains (i.e., Jenkins, Spinnaker, Azure DevOps, GitHub). **preferred**
	+ Understanding of Data & AI technologies in context of app development (e.g., SQL and NoSQL Databases, Big Data, Cognitive Service, Machine Learning etc.). **preferred**
	+ Understanding of AI services, how to leverage them in the composition of modern application infrastructures (OpenAI). **preferred**
	+ Competitive landscape. Knowledge of cloud development platforms. **preferred**

  


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Project Engineer Intern
description:
DTN is a global leader providing insights and analytics to our customers to feed, fuel, and protect the world. We help people make critical business decisions that impact the agriculture, oil and gas, trading, and weather industries.  

It’s a difference you’ve likely felt without even knowing it. From the food on your plate to the gas in your car to the last flight you took, chances are a DTN customer made it possible. And that’s just for starters. That’s why we say, “When our customers prosper, we all win.”
Job Description:
Project Engineering Intern for System Integration and Testing
Objective: The intern will support the project engineers in the Utrecht office in the testing, configuration, installation, and commissioning of system components for various projects. They will also assist in generating labeling plans and supporting the logistics department in packing list generation and shipment control. The intern will be responsible for supporting the implementation and documentation of a new system in our Utrecht office. This project involves various tasks related to safety management, logistics, compliance, system design, Factory Testing, training, and documentation. The intern will work closely with the project team to ensure a successful implementation and smooth handover to support.
What you will be responsible for:* Assisting in the development of safety management plans, logistic support plans, compliance requirements matrices, system architecture designs, system design documents, and interface control documents.
* Collaborating with vendors and suppliers to ensure the timely delivery of equipment and materials.
* Preparing site requirements and installation plans, including necessary infrastructural works at the airport.
* Supporting on ensuring a smooth transition to operational status.
* Managing the purchase equipment list and following up on hardware purchases.
* Assisting in unpacking hardware, assembling cabinets, and packing and shipping materials as needed.
* Contributing to the creation of system test plans, factory acceptance test procedures, SAT procedures, pre-FAT, FAT, pre-SAT, and SAT activities.
* Assisting in the development of technical manuals, administrator manuals, user manuals, training program plans, and related training presentations.
* Ensuring the proper documentation of safety measures and maintenance procedures.
* Participating in the creation of as-built documents that accurately reflect the implemented system.
* Supporting the project handover process to the support team.


What you will bring to the role:* Basic knowledge of electrical and communication systems
* Familiarity with configuration management tools and documentation practices
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team.


What you can expect from DTN:* The intern will work under the guidance of experienced team members and report to the Technical Design Engineer.
* This project offers valuable hands-on experience in system implementation, documentation, and project management within a professional environment.


#LI-JL1
#LI-Onsite
Why DTN?  

OUR VISION: To be the independent, trusted source of insights to our customers who feed, protect, and fuel the world.  

OUR MISSION: Empower our customers with intelligent and actionable insights that exceed their expectations and enable their success on a daily basis.  

OUR VALUES: Customer-Focused, Forward-Thinking, People-Centric, Solution-Oriented  

We have great benefits at DTN – apply today to find out more!  

At DTN, we are an equal opportunity employer. Come join us as we help feed, fuel, and protect the world!
\*\* DTN is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Solutions Architect IAM 4 Employees
description:
As an IAM (Identity and Access Management) Solutions Architect, your role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining robust IAM solutions within an organization. Specifically focused on IAM 4 Employees. As an IAM Solutions Architect, you play a crucial role in ensuring the security and integrity of digital assets related to employee access.

**You and your job**

As part of the IAM architecture team your key responsibility is to translate our IAM vision into architecture and specifications, interacting with key stakeholders to achieve the best possible result. The team you will be part of consists of 5-6 Solution Architects and takes responsibility for the full architecture lifecycle, from new ideas into clear specifications and principles ready for detailed design.


We expect you have a good, generic overview and understanding of the capabilities of IAM solutions so as to match needs and requirements to standards and capabilities of the tools we work with.


Continuous improvement is self-evident to you, and you dare to be critical of the current working method and tooling. You are a go-getter who prefers to work in a team. You stand for high-quality products and everything that goes with them. This makes you a versatile member of the team.

**Top 3 responsibilities**

* Translate high level targets into architecture, designs and a blueprint for solutions, align with Product owners, DevOps teams and other stakeholders
* Rely on your experience in design patterns, published reference architectures and guidance from Business Architects and other (internal) stakeholders like the Cyber Defense Centre and First Line Risk Management
* Generate or enhance Architecture and Design artifacts such as a solution architecture document and technical requirements design document for each of the individual IAM components, diagrams, and technical presentations
* Work on new topics such as eIDAS, advanced IAM analytics and more


Besides that, you will be a sparring partner for business, the development team, product owner, and other stakeholders. You will be and remain abreast of the latest market and technological developments and incorporate these in the execution of your architecture designs. You will also play a key role in monitoring and ensuring the quality of the work of the DevOps team and act as an expert in IAM capabilities and security control discussions.

**Together we achieve more than alone**  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So, we are very curious about what you can bring to the team.


‘Working in the Tribe IAM means working within a department that is fundamental for the operation and risk management of the bank. We have a large change agenda to improve IAM in a user-friendly and secure manner, for which growth, simplification, innovation and results will be central in the coming period. You can make an important contribution by supporting our engineers and machines*.’* Sanne Verdam, Tribe Lead IAM.

**You and your talent**

* Academic thinking and work level with a Bachelor/Master degree in a relevant field of expertise.
* Experience with (hybrid) cloud environments and platforms (MS Azure, AWS and Google platform) and the IAM features they present
* Experience in working with multiple IGA and Access Management products; experience with OneIdentity is preferred
* Knowledge and implementation experience with the usual IAM protocols for authentication, authorization, user provisioning and single sign-on, such as OAuth, OpenID Connect, SAML, Bearer Token, Kerberos/NTLM, LDAP authentication, SCIM;
* Certifications may include: CISSP, CISM, MS MC: Azure Security Engineer. AZ-500 (preferred)
* Preference for candidates with training & experience with: TOGAF, SABSA, Archimate
* Strong creation & writing skills
* Excellent communication in English is required
* Judgement & Decision making (Practitioner)
* Agility (Master)
* Complex problem solving (Master)
* Collaborating with others (Master)

**This is what we offer you**


* A salary between € 61.383,- and € 87.690,- gross per year (scale 10)
* A thirteenth month and holiday pay
* An Employee Benefit Budget. You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions or even receiving a monthly cash payout


This is the selection of the terms of employment for a Solutions Architect IAM 4 Employees based on a 36-hour working week. This vacancy is for 36 hours per week. You can find all our terms of employment on.  

  

**You and the job application process**


Reply to the vacancy for Tech Lead IAM4Employees at Rabobank before as soon as possible.

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Max Nuij, Tech lead IAM4Employees, via max.nuij@rabobank.com
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Sylvana Janssen, Recruiter, via sylvana.janssen@rabobank.nl.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.


#LI-SJ1

title: Customer Activity Monitoring (CAM) Analyst
description:
### **Function**


Do you want to make a difference and contribute to creating a better world? Are you interested in developing your skills and knowledge, while putting your ideals to work? Join us, we are a frontrunner in ethical banking and global impact investing, and we need people like you to make change happen.



We believe that money can change the world for the better. In fact, our organisation was founded on this belief. Our mission is to create a society that protects and promotes the quality of life of all its members with human dignity at its core.



The group KYC & Financial Crime department works on uniform and efficient processes and creating single points of responsibility for the group. To make this possible we would like to bring on board an analytical-thinking professional for the role of Customer Activity Monitoring (CAM) Analyst.

### **Profile**

**How you will make a difference**



You will help us to ‘finance change to change finance’, by protecting our organisation and customers from money laundering, terrorism financing and other criminal activities through analysing data, identifying patterns in monitored transactions, providing reports on the findings and providing input into improving our CAM framework. You will advise and contribute to strengthening our CAM models. You will work in close collaboration with CAM specialists and other relevant stakeholders.





As a part of your daily routine


* You will provide analysis on Customer Activity Monitoring (post transaction monitoring) and knowledge of business processes to define changes and support implementation
* You will identify new AML/CTF measures and business rules or improvements for existing measures and rules
* You will work closely with other team members to develop, maintain and improve our CAM model lifecycle and work on behavioural models and static rules.
* You will contribute to the back-testing of our behavioral models and static rules
* You will prepare, enhance and deliver reporting for CAM related topics within the AML/CTF area including thematic research and contribute to proposals for the use of advanced analytics & AI in the area of Customer Activity Monitoring
* You will support CAM reporting including the performance of the business rules and reporting of any relevant Operational Risk events


**What you will bring**



Your unique potential and your values matter for us most. We look for people who are self-aware and who think in a holistic way, always conscious about their impact on society, environment, and the economy.



To be successful in this role, you will:


* need to zoom out and identify what is needed for whole perspective.
* when faced with ambiguity or uncertainty, identify critical information and formulate a timely response
* act with integrity and honesty, daring to speak up and have difficult conversations when needed
* set up partnerships and networks, build and maintain relationships with relevant stakeholders with different backgrounds


Furthermore, it is desirable that you will have:


* an extensive relevant working experience as a CAM analyst or in a closely related role
* a broad knowledge and expertise within the AML/CTF field in the financial sector, specifically with analysing and improving CAM rulesets and models including model lifecycle management and the application of advanced techniques.
* a proven experience with, and knowledge of, an Agile way of working in an IT environment
* practice in working as a business partner with a strong judgment and an excellent analytical skills
* proficient command of English and Dutch (Spanish or German language skills are a plus)


**Your future colleagues**



Together with other KYC & FC Analysts and Specialists you form the Monitoring & Screening team of the KYC & FC Centre of Expertise (within this team your expertise is with CAM). You report directly to the Team Lead Monitoring & Screening. On a day-to-day basis, you work in multi-disciplinary teams with ICT, operations and/or Compliance. You regularly work in the CAM Fusion team together with dedicated engineers or you work together with other KYC & FC Specialists and Analysts on joint topics (main focus on Risk and Control framework and SIRA input). Therefore, the work on a day-to-day basis will be very diverse.

### **Offer**

**What we offer you**


**An inspiring work culture**

The most important thing about working with us is that you are part of community that is changing the world for the better. We are constantly improving our work culture to create conditions where every person can thrive, so you are able to:


* find a sense of meaning in your work
* create positive energy and impact with your co-workers
* build mutual trust and respect in working relationships
* enjoy fulfilment at a professional and personal level


**A comfortable working environment**

Our award-winning sustainable head office is based in Driebergen-Zeist, the Netherlands at the Reehorst Estate, just a 3 minutes’ walk from the train station. Combined with working from home, it is an inspiring place to work and connect with your colleagues.





**And of course, great remuneration and working conditions:**


* a salary appropriate to the position, our remuneration policy and your experience
* an attractive pension policy
* a mobility card (including free private travels)
* flexible working hours and the opportunity to work from home
* reimbursement of a company bicycle to the max of € 1,500
* 30 holiday days with a 40-hour working week, plus the option of buying 2 weeks of extra holiday days
* extra leave to contribute to voluntary work
* a range of education and training opportunities
* the option to join our collective health insurance
* a working from home allowance per home office day
* suitable home office equipment up to € 750 every 5 years


**Sounds interesting?**



If you feel that you want to make a difference, don’t hesitate to join the Triodos community by applying for this role.



Everyone is welcome to join us. Our culture is built on values that aim to benefit both society and individuals. We are committed to equity and diversity, and we value everyone’s perspective. We strive to create an environment in which all co-workers and our broader community can feel safe and included.


**The closing date for applications is: 19.07.2024**



If the role interests you but you still have some questions, please connect with us via email: careers@triodos.com. If there are any additional adjustments you may need during the application process, please let us know.



We also don’t want to miss out on candidates who feel they don’t exactly match the job description, so if this is a role that sounds interesting to you, and you feel you could add value, please apply!



\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_


**Who we are**


**Triodos Bank** is a leading expert in sustainable banking, founded in 1980 in the Netherlands, with branches in Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, and Spain.


**Triodos Investment Management** is a globally recognised leader in impact investing, that currently manages 20 funds invested in both Europe and emerging markets.


**Triodos Regenerative Money Centre** is our business unit launched in 2019 with the explicit goal of restoring and regenerating nature and society.



We are a certified **B Corp** since 2015. B Corp is a growing global community of successful and sustainable companies that create positive social impact and change.



We are also one of the founders of **The Global Alliance for Banking on Values**, a global network of independent banks using finance to deliver sustainable economic, social, and environmental development.



www.triodos.com | www.triodos-im.com | www.triodosfoundation.nl
company_description: Triodos Investment Management is a wholly owned subsidiary of Triodos Bank, one of the world's leading sustainable banks.

title: GenAI Engineer
description:
Als (Junior) GenAI Engineer bij adesso Data & AI speel je een cruciale rol in het implementeren van GenAI technologie in de bedrijfsprocessen van onze klanten. Je werkt nauw samen met Data Scientists en Data Engineers om nieuwe slimme toepassingen te creëren die het leven van mensen beter maken. Met deze AI-oplossingen heb je de kans om grote impact te maken in allerlei sectoren, van finance tot gezondheidszorg tot overheid.


**Verantwoordelijkheden:**


* Ondersteunen bij het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en optimaliseren van nieuwe AI-oplossingen.
* Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams om AI-oplossingen te integreren in bestaande bedrijfsprocessen.
* Evalueren van de resultaten en communiceren van bevindingen aan stakeholders.
* Continu blijven leren en ontwikkelen op het gebied van AI-technologieën en -methoden.


**Profiel:**


* Afgeronde Master in Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een verwante discipline.
* Sterke Python vaardigheden
* Goed begrip van de werking van LLMs en gerelateerde GenAI technologie
* Basisvaardigheden op het gebied van DevOps: version control, samenwerken op een repository en code management
* Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden.
* Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om technische concepten helder uit te leggen.
* Pre: Hands-on ervaring met GenAI platforms en tools
* Pre: Ervaring met Azure of AWS


**Ons Team**



Bij adesso Nederland werken we met een jong en gedreven team van. Naast het werken aan klantprojecten, zetten we ons ook in voor productontwikkeling. Want zeg nu zelf, hoe gaaf is het als je je eigen product kunt implementeren bij een klant? Onze teamleden zijn gepassioneerd, innovatief en altijd op zoek naar manieren om onze oplossingen en diensten te verbeteren.


**Onze Culture Code**



Bij adesso vormt onze "Culture Code" de basis van ons dagelijks handelen. Deze code benadrukt eenheid, pragmatisme, eerlijkheid en openheid, en respect voor diversiteit. Onze kernwaarden - WE ARE ONE adesso, WE ARE HANDS-ON, WE ARE STRAIGHTFORWARD, en WE ARE OPEN-MINDED - helpen ons om een sterke en succesvolle bedrijfscultuur te handhaven.

 **Data & Analytics Opportunities**



Ben jij niet bang voor "Big Data"? Ben jij een AI optimist? En zit D&A echt in jouw DNA? Wij zijn altijd op zoek naar nieuwe collega's die zich herkennen in onze waarden en zich willen aansluiten bij ons dynamische team. Heb je interesse om deel uit te maken van adesso Data & AI en bij te dragen aan ons succes? Neem dan contact met ons op en ontdek de mogelijkheden!


**Wat Wij Bieden**



Bij adesso Nederland bieden we een aantrekkelijke werkomgeving met uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden:


* **Contract voor onbepaalde tijd**: Full-time of Part-time (32/40 uur).
* **27 vakantiedagen**.
* **Ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden**: Een ruim opleidings- en persoonlijk ontwikkelingsbudget van 3600 euro per jaar, volledig beheerd door jou.
* **4 Studiedagen**.
* **Mobiliteitsregeling**: Keuze uit een leaseauto of een jaarlijks OV-abonnement met een ruime mobiliteitsvergoeding.
* **Faciliteiten voor thuiswerken**.
* **Vrijheid in het plannen van je werkdag**.
* **Pensioenregeling en andere wettelijke regelingen**.
* **Aanvullende werknemersverzekeringen**.
* **Een open cultuur die kennisdeling stimuleert**.
* **Aantrekkelijke carrièremogelijkheden**, zowel nationaal als internationaal.

title: Teamlead Embedded Software Engineering
description:
Do you get thrilled by delivering best-in-class firmware solutions? Do you have a background in embedded software development and do you have leadership skills? Are you interested to work for a growing and innovative high tech company, where people and fun are part of our core values? We'd love to have you!

  


### **Who is Movella**



Movella is a leading full-stack provider of sensors, software, and analytics that enable the digitization of movement. Movella serves the entertainment, health & sports, and automation & mobility markets. Our innovations enable our customers to capitalize on the value of movement by transforming data into meaningful and actionable insights. Partnering with leading global brands such as Electronic Arts, EPIC Games, 20th Century Studios, Netflix, Toyota, Siemens, and over 1000 sports organizations/research institutions/universities. Movella is creating extraordinary outcomes that move humanity forward. To learn more, visit www.movella.com.

### **Your role as Teamlead Embedded Software Engineering at Movella**



As the Team leader Embedded Software Engineering you are responsible for coaching and managing the Embedded Software team. This team develops firmware for new and existing sensors for different business lines. You will lead a growing team of enthusiastic Embedded Software Engineers. You and your team will be working on products that focus on capturing, processing and sharing data on body and motion. These products provide premium solutions for animation, human motion measurement, sports, healthcare and industrial applications.  



  

You will be working together in an Agile/Scrum team. Your team is part of the Engineering and Technology team, consisting of functional team in fields of expertise such as Application Software Engineering, Core algorithms, Electronics Design, Manufacturing, Cloud Services,and Quality Assurance. This team works closely and in sync with the product managers and the Line of Business Directors to address the needs of our existing and new customer base. You will report to our VP Engineering.

 **Key challenges :**


* Firmware development; including making specifications, embedded software design, test development and sensor fusion algorithm implementation
* Supervising and guiding the firmware development and test process
* Assigning resources to projects based on knowledge, experience and availability of team members
* Managing, coaching and motivating the embedded software team
* Getting and keeping the team up to speed with regard to know-how and knowledge on new technologies, ensuring knowledge is shared within the team
* Competency management; making and managing a development plan for your team members
* Creating and implementing a development plan for the tools under control of the Firmware team and making sure corresponding documentation is made
* Remaining informed on new technologies for products and tools

  

  

  

Movella is looking for an result driven and pragmatic Teamlead Embedded Software Engineering. Someone who thrives in an environment where your hands-on mentality is highly appreciated. You have:


* Bachelor/Master degree in Computer Science, Embedded Systems or related
* At least 7 years’ experience in Embedded Software Engineering
* Experience in C, C++ programming skills
* Team player, 2+ years of experience leading a team
* Knowledge of embedded software development for Microcontrollers
* High proficiency in English and preferably in Dutch as well
* Technical background of semiconductor industry processes, process integration, process control, semiconductor devices and manufacturing is a plus
* Excellent communication and social skills
* Experience of Agile/scrum methodology and practices is a must

### **Working at Movella**


*Movella is made up of people who are inquisitive and entrepreneurial by nature. You’ll find support at every level, an open door to every level, and cooperation across teams, disciplines and departments We offer a position in an innovative, ambitious and international environment, with an attractive compensation package. You'll receive full training in our products and services and have opportunities for personal growth and development.*

 *We value* ***ingenious*** *ideas, no matter where they come from. We believe* ***diverse*** *thoughts, voices, and backgrounds make us stronger as a company. We know that it is through* ***collaboration*** *with people from all walks of life that we make the most positive* ***impact*** *as an organization.*

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
Do you get thrilled by developing tools focusing on the quality of production methods? Do you have a background in Electronics / Mechatronics or similar and like having a coordinating role in a high-tech manufacturing environment? We'd love to have you! At Movella you work for a growing and innovative company, where people and fun are part of our core values.

### **Who is Movella**



Movella is a leading full-stack provider of sensors, software, and analytics that enable the digitization of movement. Movella serves the entertainment, health & sports, and automation & mobility markets. Our innovations enable our customers to capitalize on the value of movement by transforming data into meaningful and actionable insights. Partnering with leading global brands such as Electronic Arts, EPIC Games, 20th Century Studios, Netflix, Toyota, Siemens, and over 1000 sports organizations/research institutions/universities. Movella is creating extraordinary outcomes that move humanity forward. To learn more, visit www.movella.com.

### **Your role as a Manufacturing Engineer at Movella**



As a Manufacturing Engineer you are the linchpin between our Engineering and Operations. You will work closely with both departments to ensure a smooth transition between product development and production.



You are responsible for taking the lead in developing and maintaining tools for assuring the quality of production methods for Movella’s product lines. You will set up automated test procedures and reporting, both in-house as well as working with manufacturing partners.

  

You will work closely with the Hardware Engineers on implementing the new or making modifications to the Quality Assurance Protocol and productions methods. You focus on ensuring that product quality risks are traced and quantified upfront to provide feedback during product development. The position requires continuous interaction with Operations, Engineering, and our partners.


You will be part of the Engineering Team, based in Enschede, the Netherlands.

 **Key challenges:**


* Conduct (D)FMEA and root cause analysis for projects
* Collect data from reports and tests to identify trends and issues
* Develop and implement test tooling for the production environment
* Implement changes to quality processes to reduce defects
* Actively follows-up as and when required on manufacturer interactions/evaluations/feedback
* Actively searches for opportunities to reduce the yield loss and lower production costs
* Apply SPC and develop new quality tools
* Supports the Field Application Engineer with RMA’s and customer support
* Become an active project team member to represent manufacturing

  

  

  

Movella is looking for a thorough Manufacturing Engineer. Someone who thrives in an environment where your analytical thinking is highly appreciated. You have:


* Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering & Management, Electronics, Mechatronics or related
* Diagnostic Information Gathering
* Affiliation with statistics and willing to apply for Lean Green belt
* Knowledge on Lean Six Sigma
* Interest in Quality Assurance and improvement
* 1 - 3 years’ experience as Process/Manufacturing Engineer
* Result driven, proactive and conscientious personality
* Good communication skills in both Dutch and English

### **Working at Movella**


*Movella is made up of people who are inquisitive and entrepreneurial by nature. You’ll find support at every level, an open door to every level, and cooperation across teams, disciplines and departments We offer a position in an innovative, ambitious and international environment, with an attractive compensation package. You'll receive full training in our products and services and have opportunities for personal growth and development.*

 *We value* ***ingenious*** *ideas, no matter where they come from. We believe* ***diverse*** *thoughts, voices, and backgrounds make us stronger as a company. We know that it is through* ***collaboration*** *with people from all walks of life that we make the most positive* ***impact*** *as an organization.*
