title: Senior Staff Software Engineer - Privacy
description:
P-1125



Summary



At Databricks, we are obsessed with enabling data teams to solve the world's toughest problems, from security threat detection to cancer drug development. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform, so our customers can focus on the high-value challenges that are central to their missions.



Our engineering teams build highly technical products that fulfill real, important needs in the world. We constantly push the boundaries of data and AI technology, while simultaneously operating with the resilience, security, and scale that is critical to making customers successful on our platform.



Customers trust Databricks with their most valuable data and Trust & Safety has the mission to build the most trusted data analytics and ML platform in the world. Security Engineering is an integral part of Trust & Safety and has a critical role to play in keeping customer data from bad actors. We are looking for senior leaders such as yourselves to create the vision and define the strategy for this space.


**The impact you will have:**


* Make Databricks safer for our customers by identifying and plugging key gaps in our infrastructure and services
* Attract top talent from across the industry.
* Represent the security engineering discipline throughout the organization, having a powerful voice to make us more data-driven
* Represent Databricks at academic and industry conferences & events


**What we look for:**


9+ years of experience in Data Security or related areas and expertise in two or more of the following* -Cryptography, Kubernetes Security, Web Security, Governance, Privacy, Trust, Safety, Authentication, Identity Management, Access Control, Key Management, Inter-Service Authentication, Secure Application Frameworks, Detection & Response. Experience building systems at large scale internet companies is a huge plus.
* 15+ years of experience building large scale distributed systems with high availability
* Leadership skills and experience to lead across functional and organizational lines
* Strong communication skills to explain and evangelize Data Security to senior leaders across the company
* Bias to action and passion for delivering high-quality solutions
* MS or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related fields


**Benefits**


* Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, and vision
* Equity awards
* Flexible time off
* Paid parental leave
* Family Planning
* Gym reimbursement
* Annual personal development fund
* Work headphones reimbursement
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Business travel accident insurance
* Mental wellness resources

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.


**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**


**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**
company_description: Databricks, the data and AI company, helps data teams solve the world’s toughest problems.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
**''Customer success** **shouldn't just be a department, it should be the entire company''**  

We already have a strong foothold at the Dutch market but we can't be stopped there! You are the success factor for our customers because you will be the first point of contact. It excites you to build and maintain trusted relationships with your customers and you are able to manage customer expectations. It is your task to guide customers in achieving their goals and you are also responsible for the commercial opportunities.  



  

In your role as Customer Success Manager you will be joining the Premium Small team within Effectory. Your team focusses on customer segment below 1500 employees. You will be part of a fast phased innovating team to continuously improve the customer journey and our product and services. We are constantly innovating so your voice must be heard to! Are you ready for a fresh start?  



  

* You will plan, coordinate and manage the onboarding and engagement of multiple customers at the same time. Besides that, you act as their main point of contact.
* You will set clear goals together with the customer and conduct quarterly meetings to zoom-out, evaluate and sharpen the objectives.
* You make sure our customers get the most out of our product and complementary services. With this we aim to helping grow our customer base and maximizing value from our customers.
You continuously share knowledge with the sales and products teams to explain the demands of the markets while forecasting trends.  
* 
  

  

* You have the ability to translate business needs to clear product (feedback) improvements.
* You can spot commercial opportunities and are not afraid to close the deal.
* You build and maintain trusted relationships with your customers and you're able to manage customer expectations.
* With your experimental mindset you can operate effectively with uncertainty and change.
* You have a desire to continuously improve business processes, the ability to juggle multiple tasks at once and can think outside of the box.
* With your highly learning and technical ability you can quickly adapt to our changing systems & software.
* You are fluent in **Dutch** (this is a must!).
*Do you have* a high level of self-support, sense of responsibility, initiative, and collaborative spirit? Than you will be a perfect match with us.  

  



  

**THIS IS US**


Effectory is Europe’s leading employee feedback solution. With our platform, HR and management we collect employee feedback throughout the employee journey. This feedback is transformed into people analytics that informs strategies to boost productivity, engagement and retention. Built on 25 years’ experience, our 200 specialists in Amsterdam and Munich support more than 1,200 organizations in 110 countries. Now more than ever, HR is an integral part of business strategy, which is why our feedback solution is tailor-made for strategic HR.  



  

**Effectory’s** **mission**

We are dedicated to improving the working world by giving employees a voice and making sure their feedback has an impact. Our experts work with HR teams and managers around the world, using employee feedback to overcome some of their biggest people-oriented challenges. From software engineers to HR specialists, every day Effectory’s people work to improve the working world, and we are looking for talented individuals who also want to be part of this mission.  



  

**THIS IS WHAT WE OFFER**


* Competitive salary (*range for this position is around:* *€ 34.*400,- € 41.400,- *gross a year, depending on your experience).*
* Bonus scheme up to 3 months of salary.
* 25 holidays for FTEs, and flexible public holiday options
* A fun and interactive onboarding program to get to know our company and some of your new colleagues
* A learning budget to spend on your own personal development. We also provide extensive professional and personal development opportunities, and also organize yearly summer and winter schools
* Flexible working: you will be able to work max 60% of your contract hours from home (or any other location in the Netherlands)
* Budget to set up your home office
* Yearly Body & Mind budget to spend on anything that energizes (or relaxes) you
* Annual events, such as our Christmas party, summer party & the legendary Big Day
* Additional monthly compensation for working from home
* The option to work abroad for up to 4 months, and to take an unpaid sabbatical
You get your birthday off work, and can also take a day to volunteer for a cause of your choice  
* 
  

**THIS IS HOW IT WORKS**


1. *You want this job*: submit your application via the link below


2. *We are intrigued*: join a phone call to further introduce yourself and ask questions


3. *We all think it went well*: we now meet live (or in a video call) to get to know each other a bit better


4. *We like each other even more*: you meet potential team members and get a bit of a pleasant grilling


5. *We want to see you in action:* you complete a case/assessment


6. *The final hurdle*: we agree on terms & conditions, we sign and you start!
company_description: At Effectory, we understand the power of both technology and human connection.

title: IT Recruiter
description:
De energiewereld verandert razendsnel. Van traditioneel naar duurzaam, van offline naar online. Bij Essent werken we iedere dag aan een duurzame toekomst. Als IT Recruiter bouw je mee aan de ambitie van Essent IT om een IT Tech company te worden. Essent IT is met zo’n 350 collega’s groot genoeg om de voordelen van een volwassen bedrijf te ervaren en tegelijkertijd klein genoeg om dynamisch te reageren. Met verschillende DevOps engineers, Architecten en diverse andere IT collega's hebben we de teams zo opgesteld dat elk team een duidelijke scope heeft en elke engineer ten volle zijn eigen inbreng en impact kan hebben. Neem zeker eens een kijkje op onze it.essent.nl blog pagina.  

  

We zijn voortdurend in beweging en hebben een tomeloze ambitie. Als IT Recruiter lever je hieraan een belangrijke bijdrage, waarbij de candidate experience bovenaan staat: jij bent de expert op het gebied van recruitment en de IT arbeidsmarkt en weet de allerbeste kandidaten te vinden en te overtuigen om op deze (snel)trein te springen.


Alleen samen zetten we de volgende stap in de energietransitie. Jij bent als IT Recruiter dé expert binnen jouw vakgebied bij het:


* Stakeholdermanagement. Je bent namelijk op de hoogte van de ontwikkelingen in de IT (arbeids)markt en pakt een stevige expertrol richting de hiring managers binnen onze IT afdeling
* Hebben van een creatieve blik op werving, en het organiseren van events, om Essent te positioneren op de arbeidsmarkt en talent aan te trekken. Dit in samenwerking met een recruitment marketeer
* Het neerzetten en uitvoeren van een efficiënt en effectief recruitmentproces
* Optimalisatie van de candidate-, manager- en recruiter experience
* Het leveren van een actieve en innovatieve bijdrage aan diverse projecten op het gebied van recruitment (intern en extern) als project lead of als team member
* Zorgen voor een energieke onboarding van nieuwe medewerkers


Je maakt deel uit van het HR Expertise team binnen de afdeling HR. Het Expertise team bestaat uit twintig collega’s die o.a. in de functies van Recruitment Business Partner, Recruitment Marketeer, Learning & Development Specialist en Reward & Recognition Specialist werken. Zij bundelen hun krachten door nieuw talent aan te trekken en te behouden, managers en medewerkers te ontwikkelen naar hun potentieel en goede begeleiding te bieden bij uit- of doorstroom van Essenters.



Benieuwd wat dit team kenmerkt? Het team bestaat uit zelfstandige professionals die de verschillende disciplines aan elkaar weet te verbinden.


Wij zoeken teamspelers en doeners die Nederland een stukje duurzamer willen maken. Die kijken naar wat er nú kan. Vandaag. Om ons dichter te brengen bij morgen. Jij herkent jezelf hierin en in het volgende plaatje:


* Minimaal hbo werk- en denkniveau
* Minimaal 3 jaar specialistische recruitment ervaring. Denk hierbij niet enkel aan ervaring met het coördineren van recruitmentprocessen van A tot Z, maar ook aan ervaring met topics als analytics, doelgroepmarketing, talentpooling en candidate experience
* Aantoonbare stakeholder- en community management capaciteiten en ervaring als tactisch/strategisch sparringpartner op diverse niveaus


De ideale kandidaat voor deze functie heeft een hands-on mentaliteit en een sterk vermogen om te kunnen verbinden. Jouw communicatieve vaardigheden stellen jou in staat impact te maken en de juiste vragen op het juiste moment te stellen. Last but not least; jij beschikt over (stijl)flexibiliteit, overtuigingskracht en stressbestendigheid.


We waarderen de energie en motivatie die jij in je werk stopt zodat wij energiepartner van onze klanten kunnen zijn. Dat doen we met een mooi pakket aan voorwaarden. Wij bieden je:


* De kans om vanuit jouw expertise bij te dragen aan de energietransitie in Nederland!
* Een bruto maandsalaris tussen € 4.976 en € 6.851
* Een flexibel benefit budget dat je maandelijks naar wens opspaart, laat uitbetalen of inzet voor verlof. Dit budget is opgebouwd uit de waarde van: 8% vakantiegeld, 1,8% benefit bijdrage, 10 bovenwettelijke vrije dagen
* Een jaarlijkse bonus van 10% om onze waardering nog meer uit te spreken
* De mogelijkheid om hybride te werken, maar dan ook echt. Jij bepaalt waar je werkt, ieder dag weer. Liever een workation? 20 dagen per jaar mag je vanuit een ander land binnen Europa werken
* Korting op je energierekening én op alle energieproducten (zonnepanelen, warmtepomp, onderhoud etc.)
* Een prachtig hoofdkantoor op loopafstand van Centraal Station Den Bosch met o.a. een goede koffiebar, twee bedrijfsrestaurants en gratis vers fruit
* Een NS Business Card voor woon-werk verkeer of een kilometervergoeding. Jij bepaalt.
* Ontwikkel- en doorgroeimogelijkheden en bijbehorend persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget van €500 per jaar. Ook functie-gerelateerde opleidingen, trainingen en cursussen volg je op onze kosten. Internationale ambitie? Als onderdeel van de E.ON Group bieden we je ook volop ontwikkelkansen binnen de andere E.ON landen.
* En last but not least: een omgeving waarin je jezelf kunt zijn. Voor ons telt alleen wie je bent en wat je kunt. Voel je vrij om je sekse, nationaliteit en leeftijd weg te laten op je cv.


Dit is dé kans om als IT Recruiter aan de slag te gaan. Benieuwd naar het vervolg? Bekijk de stappen van onze sollicitatieprocedure hieronder.


Als energieleverancier helpen we ruim 2,5 miljoen klanten in de particuliere en zakelijke markt. Met onze merken Essent, energiedirect, Powerhouse, Vandebron en onze servicepartners door heel Nederland, helpen we onze klanten met energieoplossingen. Met duurzamer leven én energie besparen. Dat doen we met duurzame producten zoals zonnepanelen, warmtepompen en isolatie voor een energiezuinige woning. Daarnaast investeren we volop in innovatieve oplossingen die onderdeel uitmaken van het energiesysteem van de toekomst, zoals waterstof en koude- en warmte oplossingen. Samen met onze klanten, zetten we de volgende stap in de energietransitie. Essent is onderdeel van Europese speler E.ON.
company_description: Energy is in transition, but so are we. At Essent you will find an organization that wants to be the personal, expert and reliable energy partner for everyone.

title: Data Analytics Tech Lead
description:
**Are you ready to join** **the future** **of innovation at NXP?**

As a Data Analytics Tech Lead y ou will directly impact the cost efficiency and speed of NXP’s N ew P roduct Introductions , as y ou will be responsible for business insight s that enable correct R&D business decisions.  



Together with DevOps data engineers , BI DevOps engineers , and data scientists , you shape the future of the R &D data analytics. You r solutions delight R&D business with top - notch and fully automated dashboards and reports that allow for self-service business intelligence for its users.  



**This is what you will do as** **Data Analytics Tech Lead** **at NXP**

In collaboration with the rest of the hardware design analytics team, you will drive the innovation of the solutions that make up the R&D data analytics products . There is a lot of room for innovative ideas , and through collaboration you achieve your goals.  



* You w ork with solution/systems architects, tech leads of other teams , stakeholders and the team members on design decisions and interfaces with other solutions.
* You c reate and maintain solution designs for the various products that the team is responsible for .
* You c ontinuously monitor if products are developed in accordance to approved specifications of the solution design and take necessary steps if required .
* You coach & mentor other team members and students through co-development , workshops, and 1-on-1 sessions.
* You continuously make sure the team improves the code base and CI/CD pipelines for the various solutions and keeps the amount of technical debt to a minimum.
* You advis e the R&D IT organization about artificial intelligence , data science, d ata analysis, data lakes, data v isualization & reporting solutions .
**What’s** **in it for me?**

The team keeps a healthy mix of 80% development and 20% operational activities . This requires a constant eye on innovation. You can contribute to every development phase , i.e., from problem analysis and design to implementation , tes ting, and bug fixing.  



* You will receive support from your direct colleagues , a Scrum team of DevOps engineers, data engineers and data scientists.
* You will get training and personal development opportunities from NXP in alignment with your personal and professional needs.
* The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in an AWS cloud based serverless data platform architecture.
* The greatest workplace in the Netherlands (High Tech Campus Eindhoven) and a safe working environment that lives up to its company values .
**Typically** **you…**

You can describe yourself as follows:


* Minimum qualification: bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience in Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Data Science, Sof t ware Engineering, or Computer Science .
* 10 + years of working experience in a relevant technical/IT role. O f which at least 3 years as a tech lead and/or solution architect in a data domain.
* Very experienced in designing and developing cloud-based (serverless) solutions.
* A magician in writing SQL queries , python code and regex .
* Very experienced in designing and creating visually appealing reports and dashboards.
* A broad understanding of data science , including machine learning , deep learning & Generative AI .
* Passionate about automation, IaC , DevOps, MLOps , and CI/CD.
* Solution-oriented, hands-on, communicative, c ustomer-centric team player .
* Valuing the importance of working together with others to be successful as a team and as part of a larger organization .
**Creating Secure Connections and Infrastructure for a Smarter World**

NXP Semiconductors N.V. (NASDAQ: NXPI) makes products and environments safer, more sustainable, and more secure with innovative connectivity and edge processing solutions for a smarter world.  



We are in the business of better. Not just better technologies, but better innovations to improve society. As the world leader in secure connectivity and processing solutions for embedded applications, NXP is solving the world’s most complex technology challenges to accelerate business innovation, enhance how we work, and advance how we live.  



Ready to create a smarter world? Visit our career website and follow us on social: LinkedIn , Facebook , and Twitter .  



To learn more about NXP in the Netherlands, click here .  



**What can you expect**

Contract : This is a full-time position with a permanent contract. However, we are open to discuss a part-time opportunity (between 32 and 38 hours) as well.  



Benefits : Besides a competitive salary, we offer great benefits as part of our CLA. A bonus plan, possibility to purchase extra holidays, an excellent pension plan, a work from home policy, and the possibility to buy company shares with a 15% discount are some examples. When applicable we also provide a relocation package and support for your move to the Netherlands.  



Development opportunities: We believe that a key component to growing our business is to develop our people. To enable you to grow your career at NXP, we provide you with a mix of learning through on-the-job experiences, learning from industries bests, and learning through education to help you develop your core and professional skills.


Our offices : The Netherlands is home to our global headquarters (Eindhoven) along with three additional sites (Nijmegen, Delft, and Son & Breugel) and includes a diverse team of over 2000 employees with 51 different nationalities focused on R&D, manufacturing, product development, business operations, legal and sales.  



Hiring process : Applying only takes a minute! Fill in the online application and share your CV with us. After a positive screening based on your CV you will have an initial video conversation with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by several business interviews. Here are some useful tips to help you prepare .  



And more : Life at NXP is more than work alone. Join one of the many social activities that are organized by and for employees in the Netherlands, such as our Christmas parties and International Walking Day. We have a YOUNG community that organizes a mix of social and professional events for our young professionals and an active Women in Technology network. We also take time to give back to our communities by engaging young girls to learn about Technology during Girls Day or participating in several volunteering activities.  



**What’s** **next**

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we kindly invite you to apply!  



If you have any questions, we are happy to answer them. Please contact (name recruiter), (job title) on (email address or phone number).


More information about NXP in the Netherlands...
company_description: NXP Semiconductors enables secure connections and infrastructure for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make like easier and safer.

title: Interim Cloud Engineer/ Data scientist
description:
**Gaat dit over jou?**
----------------------


Vaardigheden die je goed kunt gebruiken voor deze job.

* **Je bent analytisch.** Hoofd- of bijzaak? Dat verschil zie jij meteen. Je komt makkelijk tot de kern en houdt tegelijk het overzicht.
* **Je bent in control.** Doelen zijn er om behaald te worden, daar zorg jij wel voor. Je delegeert, houdt overzicht en plant realistisch.
* **Je spreekt begrijpelijke taal.** Als je iets zegt, zorg je dat de ander het ook begrijpt. Je spreekt duidelijk en vlot, en kunt goed presenteren.
* **Je vindt altijd een oplossing.** Jij rent niet weg voor problemen. Sterker nog: je onderzoekt ze grondig. Je legt de juiste verbanden en zoekt naar mogelijke oorzaken. 'Eerst denken, dan doen' is jouw motto.
* **Je ziet het grote geheel.** Jij bent vaak drie stappen verder dan de rest. Je ziet overal verbanden en bedenkt inventieve oplossingen.
* **Je wilt presteren.** Jij weet wat je wilt, en hoe je het wilt bereiken. Daarvoor geef je alles. Zit het tegen? Jij geeft niet op en zet een tandje bij.

**Jouw baan**
-------------


The Interim Cloud Engineer Specialist is a challenging and exciting role for engineers that want to build and maintain the cloud infrastructure for VodafoneZiggo Data and Insights group. You will join a small and growing team of engineers who constantly improve the group's bigdata platform containing Machine Learning and Data Science capabilities by providing a performant and observable platform supporting the entire analytics lifecycle, from development to production. The ideal engineer has a drive for constant improvement of both themselves and the systems that they build, manage, and support. While they may not have previous experience with Bigdata and, they are able to leverage their existing knowledge of AWS as they learn and work alongside the engineers and scientists that they support.

**Dit krijg je van ons**
------------------------


Werken als Interimmer bij VodafoneZiggo levert je meer op dan een betaalde factuur:

* Een snelle laptop met alle tools die je nodig hebt.
* Gemakkelijke afhandeling van contract, facturatie en het schrijven van je uren.
* Ruimte en vrijheid om met jouw expertise het verschil te maken.

**Dit breng jij mee**
---------------------

Technology


* Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) in production use cases.
* Experience with Linux, comfortable with Amazon Linux 2 based systems.
* Development experience with programming or scripting languages like Python, etc.
* Experience with automation tools, including Cloudformation, AWS CDK.
* Experience with various Data Science tools and/or platforms, such as Athena, Jupyter Notebooks, Anaconda, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, and AWS EMR.

Personal


* Positive and solution-oriented mindset.
* Critical thinker and problem-solving skills.
* Self-motivated and self-managing.
* Understanding of agile project management and execution.
* Stays current with new and evolving technologies via formal training and self-directed education.
* Experience with developing and maintaining design documentation in confluence.
* Effective communication skills: regularly achieve consensus with peers and clear status updates.
* English written and verbal communication skills.

Responsibilities


* Deploying, building, and configuring deployment methods for Amazon Web Services, especially utilizing the AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK).
* Write scripts and automation using Python, or Typescript.
* Constantly improve service quality, security, and performance.
* Participation in agile projects, writing user stories, and create a backlog.
* Collaborate with peers and user team members
* Make sure we deliver high quality, scalable and cost efficient solutions

Must have:


* AWS architecture, services and products
* CDK
* Apache Airflow / AWS MWAA
* API Gateway
* DynamoDB/Casandra etc databases
* Prometheus / Grafana
* CICD / GitLab / Vault
* Kafka / MSK

Nice to have:


* Bigdata skills like spark / Spark streaming
* Projen
* Cloud / platform security

We are looking for Dutch residents/freelancers with a Chamber of Commerce (KVK) registration only. This is not a call for acquisition.


#LI-IO1
company_description: With over 12,000 people supporting over 18million customers, our purpose is to connect for a better future. A more inclusive, more sustainable world. Join us to make an impact you can see and feel.

title: Software Engineer NodeJS
description:
About Apeiron Insight


Apeiron Insight is a data-driven research & analytics company, providing data products and insights to investment companies. We use predictive modelling to deliver actionable intelligence to the biggest sharks in the tank. Apeiron Insight is growing fast. We are hiring for several roles in multiple disciplines to scale up our operation.


Your role with us


The Data Engineering team at Apeiron Insight is looking for a committed, creative, enthusiastic software engineer to help navigate new challenges and find solutions to the complex problems brought about by an organization growing fast.  

  

***Main responsibilities will include:***


* Develop and Maintain NodeJS based JavaScript Solutions, which can parse data from websites, at scale, and deliver that data accurately, on time, every time.
* You’ll be challenged to find solutions that can reliably extract large datasets from the web at high throughput.
* You’ll utilize custom metrics and monitoring infrastructure to build observability into data extraction processes.
* You’ll find yourself thinking outside the box about solving bugs and extraction issues.
* Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.
* Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.

What are we looking for?


* 3+ years of professional experience working with NodeJS framework and an understanding of NPM.
* Experience in web scraping and automation using TypeScript (preferred) or JavaScript.
* Strong understanding of HTTP protocol, DOM manipulation, and browser automation techniques.
* Experience with tools and libraries such as Puppeteer or similar.
* Familiarity with Apify for web scraping, automation, proxy management and rotating IP addresses.
* A self-starter willing to thrive in a start-up environment. You are expected to proactively engage with what is already in place and pitch ideas for improvement.
* You are currently living in the Netherlands and can fluently communicate in English (both verbally and in writing).
* You are legally allowed to work in the Netherlands.
* You can come to our lovely office in Rijswijk twice a week, or more.

We also use the following in our stack, so it would be helpful if you have:


* Experience instrumenting code with custom metrics for observability.
* Familiarity with SQL, MySQL, and basic knowledge of Unix terminal commands.
* Experience with version control systems such as Git/SVN.

What we offer?


This is your chance to join a dynamic data company where you’ll be part of a very ambitious and smart team on a mission. You’ll get all the benefits of working for an agile scale-up such as a relaxed work environment, the possibility to work from home part of the time, easy-going colleagues and freedom in your work. Additionally, we offer you:


* Competitive salary tailored to your skills & experience.
* 25 vacation days based on a 40 hour working week.
* 8% holiday payment.
* Profit Sharing Bonus scheme.
* Pension & Mobility Allowance.
* An annual budget of €3.000 to spend on professional or personal development.
* Hybrid work model: a mix of working from home and in the office.
* Healthy and delicious buffet breakfast, lunch and a filled refrigerator in the office.
* Everything you need to work from home: a screen, keyboard and mouse.
* Fun events with colleagues.
* A referral reward program: refer a friend for one of our jobs.

If you think this position fits you well, we sincerely hope to hear from you. If so, please submit your resume and motivation letter.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Ben jij een technisch gedreven Data Engineer die klaar is om bij onze klanten te werken aan een datagedreven toekomst? Heb je een passie voor Data Engineering en zoek je uitdagende projecten om je vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen? Sluit je dan aan bij **gaan>> consulting** en ontdek de mogelijkheden om als Data Engineer een verschil te maken.

**Wat ga je doen?**

Als Data Engineer bij **gaan>> consulting** ben je de technische expert die data-oplossingen ontwerpt, bouwt en optimaliseert. Je werkt met de nieuwste technologieën, schrijft efficiënte code en automatiseert processen. Je onderzoekt en implementeert de meest geschikte technologische tools voor het ontwikkelen van datawarehouses, datalakes en lakehouses.

**Wat heb je nodig?**

- Een afgeronde HBO- of WO-opleiding, bij voorkeur in IT of Data

- 2 tot 4 jaar relevante werkervaring

- Ervaring in (een of meer van) de volgende gebieden: SQL, Azure Data Factory, Fabric, Python, PowerBI, Synapse, Databricks, DAX en ETL/ELT processen

- Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels

- Sterk analytisch vermogen en precisie

- Beschikbaar voor 32-40 uur per week

**Wat bieden wij?**

- Een competitief salaris tussen €4.000,- en €8.000,- bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je ervaring;

- 25 vakantiedagen, met de mogelijkheid om 5 extra dagen bij te kopen;

- Een leaseauto die je ook privé mag gebruiken of een mobiliteitsvergoeding als je al een auto hebt;

- Begeleiding en coaching door ervaren professionals;

- Regelmatige teamsessies voor kennisdeling en uitwisseling van ervaringen bij klanten;

- Een telefoonvergoeding en een zakelijke laptop;

Wij werken voor klanten als ASML, Heineken, AkzoNobel, PostNL, Nationale Nederlanden, Achmea, FrieslandCampina en vele andere bedrijven. Flexibiliteit en thuiswerken behoren tot de mogelijkheden, zodat we samen kunnen bepalen welke projecten het beste passen bij jouw ambities.

**Interesse?**

Ben je klaar om jouw talenten in te zetten bij **gaan>> consulting** en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen? Wij kijken ernaar uit! Voor meer informatie over de functie van Data Engineer neem je contact op met Eloy op 06-33178406 of mail je je cv en een korte profielbeschrijving naar info@gaanconsulting.nl. **Unfortunately we cannot support visa sponsorship.**

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Description
**Your mission**

  

As **Data Analytics Engineer at Cleeng,** you will help us expand our world-class data platform along with supporting key clients with their analytics needs.


You will be a member of our Data Excellence team, working with various keys tasks, including building and enhancing our current data infrastructure stack, Business Analytics and sometimes engaging with client escalations. You will be one of the key members, who will work across the whole data domain, including Data Engineering and Business Analysis.

 **Your Responsibilities**

  

* Building data manipulation tools to feed the data lake and data warehouse. You will develop, improve and maintain data processing pipelines. In data area, we use tools like AWS Aurora MySQL, HevoData, DBT, Snowflake, Looker, MonteCarlo, Count.co among others. We use AWS as our cloud infrastructure
* Help us develop and maintain data architecture which uses Star Schema.
* Monitor client data quality and integrity, troubleshoot issues, and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* Conduct in-depth data analysis, extract meaningful insights and present in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders. Develop and maintain key client reports.
* Time to time, you will be responsible for working with client escalations.

 **The ideal candidate will have the following Competencies:**

  

* Expert and confidence in SQL, including window functions, complex joins, scalar queries.
* 2-5 years of proven experience with ETL tools. We use HevoData.
* 2-5 years of experience in using DBT, Snowflake or similar tools.
* 2+ years of experience with Looker and LookML.
* Exposure working with AWS.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
* Previous experience working in the media and entertainment industry or with sports clients is highly relevant.

 **What we offer**

  

* Flexible working hours and form of employment.
* Possibility to work 100% remotely.
* 100 % paid sick leave within the agreed limits.
* Events, celebrations.
* Work with an international team of well - rounded experts in Amsterdam (HQ), Poznan, Manila, NYC and Dubai. 16 nationalities and counting!
* Work on unique, market-leading, SaaS products, with clients all over the world, from New Zealand, Japan, Europe, US, and Latam.
* Work closely with people who value diversity, hard work, friendly relationships and love their jobs, and get all together to the next level.

  


Languages English Experience 2+ years

title: Professional, QA Engineer
description:
**Values & Innovation**
-----------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to empowering those who strive for more, and the company's values - Act Sustainably, Celebrate the Wins, Fight on Together, Love Athletes and Stand for Equality - serve as both a roadmap for our teams and the qualities expected of every teammate.

  

Our Values define and unite us, the beliefs that are the red thread that connects everyone at Under Armour. Our values are rallying cries, reminding us why we're here, and fueling everything we do.

  

Our pursuit of better begins with innovation and with our team's mission of being the best. With us, you get the freedom to go further - no matter your role. That means developing, delivering, and selling the state-of-the-art products and digital tools that make top performers even better.

  

If you are a current Under Armour teammate, apply to this position on the **Internal Career Site Here.**

**Purpose of Role**
-------------------


Under Armour is looking for a Quality Assurance Engineer to execute the continuous QA strategy for UA eCommerce iOs, Android and web applications, as well as for end-to-end landscape in EMEA region. As a part of EMEA Technology team, you will be responsible for actively adapting QA methodology in the region and instilling that Quality Assurance starts at the beginning of a project or product lifecycle with the cross functional teams.

  

As part of the EMEA eCom squad, and as a member of the Global QA Team, you will work closely with the EMEA and Global Delivery, Engineering, Program, and Product teams, to coordinate the delivery of digital products and features for UA eCommerce platforms. The QA Engineer will participate and assure quality in projects, features, and coordinated Automation testing. The QA Engineer will also contribute to requirement analysis, test design, and functional requirement verification. Furthermore, they will contribute to API testing, backend testing, data analytics testing, and UI/UX testing, where applicable.

  

We are looking for a detail-oriented self-starter, with a drive for excellence. It doesn’t hurt if you are passionate about sport and the latest fitness gear. This is a great opportunity to be an integral part of the Under Armour team, building the latest in digital & physical products that make you better.

**Your Impact**
---------------

* You will take ownership of leading the quality of an assigned project and its features
* You participate in multiple cross functional product development teams
* You ensure full-stack functionality and new user-facing features are thoroughly tested before release to minimize bugs (UI and UX analysis and testing)
* You assist assigned Delivery Lead with creating project resource estimates, metrics to track completion phase
* You create defect, defect prevention, development efficiency and quality reports
* You perform a thorough test planning (API, backend, Data Analytics) for a portfolio of application projects (cross-platform development, separate feature projects)
* You advocate the QA best practices and have an automation mindset to assist shaping our practices in the region for the future
* You partner closely with cross-functional teams (Product, Design, Engineering, Delivery, etc.), to proactively identify and manage QA dependencies, scope, and acceptance criteria
* You deeply understand user flows in the apps and website
* You work closely with production team to help prioritize risk management and testing across products and platforms
* You verify functional testing and work closely with the key technical analysts & business stakeholders
* You take an initiative to chase down answers and actively participate in Agile ceremonies, including Daily Stand-Ups, Sprint Planning, Retrospectives, and Sprint Reviews and Demos for your teams
* You coordinate keeping project artifacts up to date in UA business systems like Confluence and JIRA
* You escalate issues and impacts to delivery timelines and work proactively with teams to remove barriers to project execution
**Qualifications**
------------------

* 1-3 years of experience as a QA Engineer, working within a cross-functional team
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
* Hands-on experience with JIRA or Confluence
* Experience in Ecommerce on Wed or Native Mobile, preferably Salesforce Commerce Cloud and Headless platforms
* Basic knowledge of agile principles and scrum processes
* Proficiency in performing root cause, change impact and risk-based test analysis

 **Not obligatory / nice to have tools knowledge:**

* MySQL DB testing
* GitHub and Bitbucket
* Postman
* Jenkins CI
* Omniture & Adobe Target
* Data Layer Tagging / Tealium
* CoreMedia
* Node.js & Selenium WebDriverIO
* JavaScript
* SAP
* Vercel
* GraphQL
* Kubernetes
* AWS
* Charles Proxy
* TestRail or similar test case management tools
* A/B Testing Support
* Progressive Web Applications
**Workplace Location**
----------------------

* **Location:** This individual must reside within commuting distance from ourAmsterdam office.
* **Return to Work Designation:** Hybrid work (baseline of minimum 2 days a week in-office.)
* **Travel:** <5% of the year
**Relocation**
--------------

* No relocation provided


#LI-KC1


#LI-Hybrid

**Benefits & Perks**
--------------------

* Paid “UA Give Back” Volunteer Days: Work alongside your team to support initiatives in your local community.
* Under Armour Merchandise Discounts
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources- We offer teammates across the country programs to promote physical activity and overall well-being.
* 38 hour working week
* Hybrid work, a minimum of 2 days in the office
* 28 days holiday
* Teammate Resource groups e.g. Green Machine, Sustainability, LGBTQIA+, Women in Leading and Living, Balance for mental health and wellbeing etc.
* Human Performance Institute (Gym) on site
* Local Language course when moving from abroad
**Our Commitment to Diversity**
-------------------------------


At Under Armour, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, family or paternal status and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Under Armour believes that diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Job Description:

For one of our Distribution Centers, we are looking for quality assurance engineer. The candidate will be directly reporting Customer Satisfaction and Quality manager of Helmond DC. The candidate will oversee following activities for a given logistics and/or assembly sector. The job offers a challenging environment and attractive career opportunities in an international/multicultural context. We seek for dynamic and analytic candidate with strong leadership and influence skills.
* Monitoring, analysis and optimization of quality performance indicators: Logistic defect rate (LDR), Manufacturing defect rate (MDR), Delivery complaint rate (DCR), non quality costs (NQC)
* Improvement of process robustness through Process FMEA approach in strong collaboration with operation team and method engineers
* Daily support to production and management of the non-conformities/issues following G8D approach and Kata QRCI / representative of the quality department in the short interval animation of the sector
* Implementing and deploying of the quality fundamentals and continuous improving processes through layer process audit
* Conducting internal audits and action plan follow-up
* Leading or supporting improvement and digitalization project


Qualifications:
**Qualifications:*** Knowledge of quality and continuous improvement methods and tools : Root cause analysis, Lean 6 sigma Green-belt, G8D / PRB, FMEA, Process Control plans, Statistical process control (SPC) etc…
* ISO-9001/ Internal audit experience
* Engineering degree in quality / industrial engineering
* 2 to 3 year experience in industrial environment / high volumes automated manufacturing, distribution center or industrialization background is a plus

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
**Cloud Engineer**

Our cloud solutions are enablers of the digital transformation for business and our normal life. One of the enabling technologies for the digital transformation is cloud computing, this will enable a completely other way of working for the business.


To support this, NXP-IT formed a Cloud Center of Excellence (Cloud CoE) reporting directly into the CIO. The Cloud CoE’s goal is to enable accelerated and sustainable adoption of cloud across the enterprise (both business and IT) - maximizing the ability to realize its benefits while reducing risk. This team is recognized as the industry leading Cloud Center of Excellence for the high-tech industry.


The Cloud CoE is responsible for defining Strategy and policy for cloud computing, driving, and implementing cloud services and platforms, running proof of concepts, piloting emerging cloud technologies (e.g. GenAI, Machine Learning) and supporting business-initiatives in adapting cloud technologies (including organizational change).


As a **Cloud engineer** you are challenged to build and operate a cloud platforms and cloud products in line with vision and stakeholder expectation. You possess a good balance between technical proficiency, business understanding with communication skills. The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of cloud computing and technology systems. You should have a positive attitude and communication skills to effectively share your knowledge.


**Your Responsibilities**

* Design, implement and maintain a fully automated cloud platform and cloud products, adhering to the compliancy and security guardrails.
* Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines, re-usable cloud data products, and underlying enabling tooling for Cloud based IT services, including documentation.
* Developing and maintaining ( incl lifecycle management) re-usable cloud products.
* Work in DevOps / Scrum settings and apply techniques of continuous verification & delivery to ensure the quality of our products and services. You built it , you run it
* Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner
* Be evangelist of Cloud computing to the rest of NXP
* Stay up to speed with the newest Cloud technologies (AWS, Azure)
* Pro-actively collaborate with other IT teams and business teams
Actively participate in communities / forums / guilds on cloud computing and data solutions (e.g. data engineering, analytics, machine learning) (both external and internal to NXP)  
* 

**Our team**

* The Cloud CoE is a team of dedicated and passionate IT professionals. The team is around 30 people which are in Eindhoven the Netherlands and in Bangalore, India
* The Cloud CoE consists for Cloud platform team including enabling role and Cloud Data platform team including enabling role.

**Your profile**

**We are looking for a Cloud Data platform engineer with the following characteristics:**

* Masters or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Software Engineering
* Experience designing, executing and supporting IT Cloud Solutions
* Understand (business) requirement and translate these in technical solutions
* Proven experience in software engineering techniques, cloud-native architecture and supporting tooling
* Prior experience in working on cloud platforms (AWS, Azure or similar) and microservice-architecture oriented solutions is a definite plus
* Knowledge of the DevOps culture and principles.
* Up to date and proven experience with CI/CD pipelines and supportive tooling
* Up-to-date knowledge of cybersecurity threats, current best practices, and latest software.

Furthermore you:


* Have strong teamwork and communication skills
* Are organized, efficient, and results-driven
* Are technical, creative, analytical, open-minded and transparent on own work
* Are eager to learn and not afraid to take initiative. You know how to learn from failure
* Have great English communication skills, both verbally as in writing
* Have technical background and affinity with R&D

**What’s in it for you**

**This is what we offer to you as a working environment:**

* A recently started new energetic team that aims to be a front-runner in enabling Cloud data Services
* A challenging environment which stimulates you to continuously develop yourself as an individual with coaching, experiments and room for failure
* Be an ambassador for cloud and DevOps way of working
* Intensive collaboration opportunities with a broad range of IT and business teams
* A self-organizing team with flexibility in working hours and location
* a dynamic and informal workplace, with an environment that promotes excellence, transparency, integrity and respect.
* A global high-tech company that carries innovation in its DNA

**Creating Secure Connections and Infrastructure for a Smarter World**

NXP Semiconductors N.V. (NASDAQ: NXPI) makes products and environments safer, more sustainable, and more secure with innovative connectivity and edge processing solutions for a smarter world.


We are in the business of better. Not just better technologies, but better innovations to improve society. As the world leader in secure connectivity and processing solutions for embedded applications, NXP is solving the world’s most complex technology challenges to accelerate business innovation, enhance how we work, and advance how we live.


Ready to create a smarter world? Visit our career website and follow us on social: LinkedIn , Facebook , Twitter .


Are you as excited about this opportunity as we are we kindly invite you to apply. After a screening based on your profile you can be expected to have a phone interview with our Talent Acquisition Consultant followed by several business interviews.  



  

More information about NXP in the Netherlands...
company_description: NXP Semiconductors enables secure connections and infrastructure for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make like easier and safer.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer**

  

We love to see people grow. We empower our product teams, farmers, dealers & suppliers to move forward. Driving the digital future of Kramp Group by discovering and building great products, making life easy for our customers.


Kramp Group has been matching and exceeding customers' expectations for over 70 years, providing products and solutions in the world's most critical industry - agriculture.


Using our vast experience and industry knowledge, Kramp Group provides cutting-edge, multi-platform e-commerce, Supply Chain and Data Science solutions for the ag-tech industry. Our digital platforms serve thousands of customers each month, generating over one billion euros in revenue every year.


Our **Data vision** is to provide a centralized entry point for data to be used on self-service platforms that unlock the full potential of Data for Kramp Group, ensuring data accessibility, quality, and value generation across all departments in a unified way.

 **The mission of a Data Engineer role is** to accelerate the **rollout of our Cloud Data Warehouse** and impact **how data and technology** **are** **used to provide the** **next-generation** **tools to an organization****.**

  

You will be part of **Data Office** which is an international cross-functional team, that combines:

* Data Governance;
* Data Lake;
* Data Warehouse;
* Data Science.
  

The team is building the foundation of Kramp's **self-service analytics platform** in the Google Cloud Platform-based data warehouse (DWH). Feeding different targets as:

* Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau);
* Data-driven e-commerce applications;
* Kramp's Machine Learning platform.
 **Who are you?**

**What will help you be successful in this role?**

* Openness to engage in continuous learning and agility in addressing business challenges;
* Experience in designing, developing, documenting, and maintaining software written in Python and/or Java as well as dataflows written in SQL;
* Knowledge of different Data Modelling principles and selecting the right one depending on the needs of a consumer;
* Feeling comfortable working with Linux, git, and Docker to extend and maintain our CI/CD workflows and pipelines or are you eager to dive into this topic;
* Experience in working in cloud environments (preferably GCP or AWS);
* Experience or knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code applications like Terraform and data transformation tools as dbt and Dataform;
* Experience with Striim is an advantage.
**What do we offer?**

* The Data Office is an international, and cross-functional team, combining Business Intelligence, Pricing Management, Data Science, and Software Development;
* Working within Agile SCRUM Methodologies and the Atlassian toolchain (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, Git);
* To build our state-of-the-art cloud data warehouse, we use Python, Java, BigQuery SQL, other Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Build, Data transfers, Workflows, Schedulers and Functions;
* Making use of dbt cloud, Terraform & CDKTF and Data Modelling Tools;
* You will get deep insights into the work at an international wholesaler being in the middle of the digital transformation, you can contribute and make a real impact;
* And a lot of freedom to initiate new ideas and develop these further.
 **Some facts about us:**

* We follow the philosophy of "You build it, you own it, you love it."
* We believe in empowering individuals to take control of their own growth, with guidance provided.
* Our colleagues come from 66 different countries, creating an inclusive and open-minded environment.
* Transparent environment, mature management team with clear vision and specific goals, and open to feedback.
**What else we bring to the table:**

* 25 vacation days and 12 ADV days (based on a fulltime contract)
* Flexible working policy in hours and location
* Travel- and working from home allowance
* Profit sharing bonus
* Great budget for training and courses
* Generous pension plan
 **Do you want to join us?**  

In case you feel challenged by the above role description and requirements, we are interested in meeting you! Please use the application button and send your CV and cover letter.


If you do not fully meet all requirements for this role, and you think you would be a good match for us, please apply and convince us.


Do you have a question about this role? Please do not hesitate to contact *Julia,* Tech Talent Acquisition Specialist, *julia.bodun@kramp.com*

 **About us**


Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business. Working at Kramp means working with over 3500 international colleagues. The people at Kramp are enthusiastic, professional and involved. We speak our customers’ language, understand their challenges and earn their trust to exceed their expectations. Our promise “It’s that easy” is embedded in our culture and DNA.


Working at Kramp means:

**… you belong here! Being part of our open business community**  

**… your work makes a difference! Have an impact on what matters**


… **you will develop and realize! Learn and realize your potential**


 More about Kramp: https://www.careeratkramp.com/nl-nl

  


Varsseveld (NL)
Utrecht (NL)

title: Associate Customer Support Engineer
description:
*Full-time, Nijmegen or Remote (Netherlands)*


***Hurry up! We’ve got a dream to build!***



BlueConic is a Dutch-founded, international SaaS startup in search of an individual with grit and relentless curiosity. You will be joining our rapidly expanding Support function as an Associate Customer Support Engineer for BlueConic, responding to tickets, troubleshooting for customers, and ensuring we meet our SLAs. As the first line of support for our customers, you'll help to ensure their successful use of BlueConic. Plus, you'll leverage your dynamic mix of communication skills, problem-solving ability, and technical expertise to provide an efficient, effective, and seamless resolution to customer issues.


**In this role you will:**


* Gain expertise in the BlueConic platform by analyzing, troubleshooting, and addressing problems submitted by customers through BlueConic’s ticketing system.
* Collaborate with Customer Success Managers to gain the insight and context needed to resolve customer issues.
* Provide first-tier support by owning the intake, processing, resolution, and escalation of tickets.
* Utilize BlueConic's ticketing system to record a complete record of troubleshooting using internal notes and detailed instructions to the customer.
* Stay current on all product releases and features to educate customers and overcome technical challenges.
* Assist with the research, planning, and implementation of processes, workflows, and tools as defined by Support leadership.
* Display intentional and cultivated engagement in meetings by asking questions and providing insight.


**You have:**

* At least 2+ years working in a similar technical support role.
* Experience working with customer data platforms, digital analytics, personalization, content management systems (CMSs), tag managers, data management platforms (DMPs), and/or web-based data and marketing technologies preferred.
* Prior frontend development experience (including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript), with the ability to identify and resolve connection and coding errors.
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
* Exceptional organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks/projects and adapt to changing needs, while maintaining meticulous attention to detail.
* Strong eagerness to learn, ask questions, and contribute to the growth of a dynamic team.


**You will stand out, if you:**


* Understand how APIs can be used to send and retrieve information.
* Have worked in the martech space and/or with enterprise software.
* Have a wide variety of technical experience across multiple disciplines.
* Have worked in a company with operations around the world.


**Reasons to join us:**


* Help build the best marketing technology product ever, period.
* Take advantage of great opportunities for career advancement.
* Work with big name brands to achieve their marketing goals.
* Gain exposure to a variety of web technologies, platforms, and strategies.
* Be a part of a growing, remote-first team with employees based in the Netherlands, the United States, the United Kingdom, Canada, and beyond.
* Thrive in an inclusive, multi-cultural environment with a values-driven work culture that has been deliberately crafted from the beginning.


**About BlueConic:**  

BlueConic is the market-leading customer data platform, which gives marketers the power to liberate their data and use it to improve marketing outcomes. Our clients use BlueConic to unify individual-level data and then use that single view across channels. Our SaaS platform is the solution for challenges marketers haven’t been able to solve for years. Founded in the Netherlands with an employee presence that spans the globe and with more than 300 brands currently using the platform, our work is experienced by millions. Our mission is to make an out-sized impact, every day – for customers, for partners, for employees.


**To join the BlueCrew is to:**


* Enjoy hard work and seek out a challenge.
* Care deeply about your colleagues, the mission, and your results.
* Draw energy from the task at hand and radiate it to motivate the people around you.
* Have amazing ideas and be able to bring them to fruition.
* Prioritize hustle over title and results over resumes.
* Balance the pragmatic and systematic, repeatability and opportunism.
* Refuse to compromise on quality, honesty, or dedication.
* Insist on the highest caliber deliverables, especially when sharing externally, even when it seems excessive or nit-picky.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Nice to know (you)**
----------------------

* You have the unique opportunity to design and develop advanced Data Governance workflows, directly contributing to the vision of an autonomously operating airport.
* As a Data Engineer Collibra, you will have opportunities to enhance and further develop your skills through targeted training and participation in innovative projects within a dynamic and growing data landscape.
* With 3,000 proud colleagues, we work toward our mission: "the world's most sustainable and high quality airports.

**Connecting your world**
-------------------------


As Data Engineer Collibra you will integrate Collibra into the Data Landscape, enabling efficient Data Governance workflows. Ensuring data quality and availability for the Autonomous Airport vision. And how you approach this? That’s up to you. We trust in the way you can distinguish between main and secondary issues and make connections. You put your talents to work at:


* Integrating Collibra within the Data Landscape using methods like Edge, API, and working with tools such as Databricks, Unity Catalog, and Synapse.
* Designing, developing and maintaining workflows for Data Governance processes, including Metadata Curation, Access Management, and Business Glossary.
* Developing new Collibra features for data stewards and data consumers.
* Harvesting and integrating the Technical Lineage of data within the Data Landscape.
* Troubleshooting technical issues with Collibra and providing high-level technical configuration and documentation for integrations and workflows.

  




As part of the Data Management Team, you'll integrate and develop Collibra within the Data Landscape, creating impactful Data Governance workflows. Your work on Data Lineage and DQ tooling integration ensures data control and trust. Your expertise drives efficient short- and long-term integration of the Enterprise Data Catalog. Despite the evolving Data Landscape and complex governance processes, your drive for improvement will ensure the Catalog's success at Royal Schiphol Group Amsterdam.


**You've got this**
-------------------


Schiphol connects your world. With the best people, we make travel safe and responsible. You contribute to this by constantly coming up with new, clever things. Also, you are the talent who approaches problems as a challenge and finds a good solution for them at lightning speed. In addition, for this position you have:

* 3+ years of experience in a Data Engineer or similar role.
* Work experience in API integration, metadata harvesting, SQL, Javascript (Groovy, BPMN), Cloud connectivity and Data Integration.
* Work experience in building workflows in Collibra, based on the Data Management processes.
* Work experience in designing, developing, testing and implementing of data management solutions.
* Experience with Agile Way of Working in developing and delivering software.

  

The next skills are nice-to-have:

* Collibra Ranger/Solution Architect Certification.
* Background in Data Governance / Data Management.
* Affinity with the Aviation Industry.


**You get this**
----------------

* € 4744 to € 6582 gross per month (Schaal 12).
* A 13th month (year-end bonus).
* An NS Business Card that fully reimburses travel by public transportation to and from work.
* The possibility to work 4 x 9 hours in a 36-hour work week.
* These are just some of our terms of employment that come with this position (based on a 36-hour work week). Schiphol Group has even more to offer you. For the complete overview of all terms and conditions of employment, please visit Conditions - Werken bij Schiphol Group.

**About the Team**
------------------


The IT & Data department is creating the airport of the future. We do this using the smartest digital solutions, tools and applications. With state-of-the-art technology, we keep the airport running. Our enthusiastic team works on data-driven improvements in our processes, traveller flows and information provision. This is how we contribute to the best possible experience for travellers, customers and employees at and around the airport.


**Choose your destination**
---------------------------


What are your talents? What dreams do you have? What is your story? We are curious about you and invite you to apply. You can apply by sharing your motivation and resume with us via the application button below.


* Do you have questions about the application process? Contact Erwin Schuur, Recruitment Business Partner, by sending a message to erwin.schuur@schiphol.nl.
* For more information about applying at Schiphol Group: Job application process - Werken bij Schiphol Group.
* For the safety of our passengers and colleagues, a security screening (Certificate of Conduct) is always part of the recruitment process.

**About Schiphol Group**
------------------------


With 3,000 proud colleagues, we go the extra mile to connect the Netherlands with the rest of the world in the best possible way. Innovation, safety and cooperation are at the forefront. Together we give more meaning to travel and contribute to the economy and society. For more than 100 years. In the Netherlands and beyond. By the way, did you know that:


... Schiphol Group owns and operates Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Rotterdam The Hague Airport and Lelystad Airport? We also have a majority stake in Eindhoven Airport.  

… there were a total of 61.7 million travellers from and to Schiphol Airport in 2023?

title: Business Analyst – Data & Analytics Global Regions – D&A Prin. IT Business Analyst
description:
**Careers that Change Lives**  

Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions: Medtronic technologies transform the lives of two people every second, every hour, every day. And counting. Our engineers and scientists work in relentless pursuit of solutions that improve lives, harnessing the power of artificial intelligence, data insights and robotic-assisted surgery. We may not know what the future holds, but we are boldly attacking the most challenging health problems facing humanity, searching out and finding solutions.
  

We are now looking for a (Principal) IT Business Analyst to join our Global Region APAC and EMEA team.


**A Day in the Life**  

* You enjoy being part of a global team that is designing and building data pipelines that combine and transform raw data into valuable action based data products. You are proud, enthusiastic on the work you do and are always looking for opportunities to improve the data products our team makes. The Global Region Data & Analytics department is responsible for delivering all data products within the EMEA & APAC & AMER regions.
* As an IT Business Analyst, you will liaise with our business partners and advise them on the data & analytics solutions and opportunities that will support their strategic ambitions.
* You will facilitate workshops with our internal customers to gather their information needs, then connect with the technical teams to come up with the best set-up on how to implement the solution.
* You will play a key role in assessing and designing solutions from a functional perspective, while keeping our business partners informed.
**Must Haves**  

* Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in job offered or a similar role in analytics & data management,
* Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management abilities, including the ability to present technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
* BS/MS with quantitative focus (e.g. Information Management, economics)
* Extensive experience in gathering, documenting, and challenging business requirements
* Able to explain technical concepts in clear words to non-technical stakeholders
* Good presentation and (data) visualization skills
* (Strong) knowledge of the fundamentals of Business Intelligence and/or data warehousing (is a plus)
* Experience with Tableau and/or PowerBI (is a plus)
**Nice to Haves**  

* You love to work with data! And transform raw data to actionable insights for the business
* Must be fluent in English
* Can manage big data related projects from requirements engineering and stakeholder perspective
* Strong business acumen and stakeholder management skills, strategic thinking
* Agile mindset and familiar with Agile way of working
* Outstanding team player with strong communications skills
**We Offer**  

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package to all our employees:
  

* Flexible working environment
* Annual Incentive Plan % depending on company results
* Pension scheme and group discount on healthcare insurance
* Training possibilities via Cornerstone/Skills Lab
* Employee Assistance Program and Recognize! (our global recognition program)
**Our Commitment**  

Our unwavering commitment to inclusion, diversity, and equity (ID&E) means zero barriers to opportunity within Medtronic and a culture where all employees belong, are respected, and feel valued for who they are and the life experiences they contribute. We know equity starts beyond our workplace, and we must play a role in addressing systemic inequities in our communities if we hope to have long-term sustainable impact. Anchored in our Mission, we continue to drive ID&E forward both to enhance the well-being of Medtronic employees and to accelerate innovation that brings our lifesaving technologies to more people in more places around the world.


**About Medtronic**  

Bold thinking. Bolder actions. We are Medtronic.
  

We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions. Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people. Powered by our diverse knowledge, insatiable curiosity, and desire to help all those who need it, we deliver innovative technologies that transform the lives of two people every second, every hour, every day. Expect more from us as we empower insight-driven care, experiences that put people first, and better outcomes for our world.
  

In everything we do, we are **engineering the extraordinary** .


**Your Answer**  

Is this the position you were waiting for? Then please apply directly via the apply button!


#LI-Hybrid

title: Data scientist
description:
**Zoetermeer*** **Junior**
* **WO**
**Highlights**
--------------


Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 3900,- en maximaal € 5708,- afhankelijk van je werkervaring  

#20011
**Wil jij bijdragen aan innovatieve analytische oplossingen voor de zakelijke markt? Als Data Scientist bij KPN Zakelijke Markt werk je samen met een team van gepassioneerde professionals aan vooruitstrevende AI-projecten. We zoeken een data scientist die zowel technische vaardigheden als een sterk statistisch inzicht combineert. Je krijgt de kans om zowel traditionele als generatieve AI-oplossingen te ontwikkelen die direct impact hebben op commerciële waarde, klanttevredenheid en/of operationele efficiëntie. Kies voor deze rol en geniet van een dynamische werkomgeving met volop mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke groei en ontwikkeling.**


**Jouw rol als Data scientist**
-------------------------------


In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het creëren van data-gedreven oplossingen binnen ofwel de service & operations of de commerciële afdelingen van KPN Zakelijke Markt, afhankelijk van de specifieke vacature. Je werkt aan analyses en voorspelmodellen om processen te optimaliseren, klanttevredenheid te verhogen, en next best actions te bepalen voor klanten of sales te voorspellen en te verhogen. Met generatieve AI open je nieuwe mogelijkheden voor het verbeteren van productiviteit, klantbeleving en creatie van commerciële content. Jouw werkzaamheden kunnen onder andere omvatten:

* Customer Journey analyses
* Voorspellen van optimale bezetting van de service desk
* NPS voorspelling en -verklaring
* Voorspellen en optimaliseren van de sales & delivery keten (commerciële rol)
* Bepalen van (realtime) next best offers & actions voor klanten voor de betrokken accountmanager of partner (commerciële rol)
* Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van digitale assistent applicaties, content creatie, en andere productiviteit verbeteringen met generatieve AI (commerciële rol)
* Optimaliseren van call routing (service & operations rol)
* Digitaliseren en personaliseren van het servicedomein (verhogen van web & app gebruik door klanten) (service & operations rol)


**Dit is je team**
------------------


Je komt terecht in een open, behulpzaam en gezellig team van 10 data scientists. Het team heeft een flexibele werkstijl, waarbij zowel thuiswerken als op kantoor werken mogelijk is. Dagelijks houden we contact, zelfs tijdens thuiswerkdagen, met virtuele dagstarts en spontane koffiemomenten. Daarnaast maakt het team deel uit van de grotere AI-community binnen KPN, met ongeveer 50 data scientists die regelmatig bijeenkomen voor kennisuitwisseling en leuke activiteiten.
**Wat breng**
**jij ons?**
--------------------------


Je bent leergierig en gedreven om te groeien. Experimenteren en nieuwe dingen uitproberen geven jou energie, en je bent pragmatisch in je aanpak. Het vertalen van business uitdagingen naar analytische oplossingen gaat je goed af, en je bent een echte teamplayer. Je hebt een sterke technische achtergrond gecombineerd met een diepgaand statistisch inzicht.


Om dit succesvol te doen heb je in ieder geval:

* Een WO-opleiding in informatica, econometrie, data science of een aanverwante studie
* Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal
* Sterk analytisch en probleemoplossend vermogen
* Affiniteit met het Service & Operations domein of het Commerciële domein (marketing & Sales)
* Bereidheid tot het doen van deels repeterend werk (zoals modelonderhoud)


Tik je niet alle bullets aan? We nodigen je alsnog van harte uit om te reageren.
**Wat krijg je**
**van ons?**
-----------------------------


Natuurlijk hebben we als werkgever jou ook veel te bieden. Dit krijg je van ons:

* Een bruto maandsalaris conform CAO afhankelijk van je werkervaring op basis van 37 uur
* Keuzetijd tot en met 40 uur per week mogelijk, waardoor je er maximaal 8,5% brutosalaris bij krijgt
* Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris (inclusief 8% vakantiegeld)
* Een variabele-bonusregeling van 9% behorende bij schaal 13
* Jaarlijks een individuele en collectieve verhoging conform onze CAO
* Goede doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden en een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget van € 1500,-. Sterker nog, we verwachten van jou dat jij je blijft ontwikkelen!
* Een goede werk-privé balans (zoals 2 dagen kantoor, 3 dagen thuis, transitieverlof, feestdagwissel naar een feestdag van jouw religieuze of culturele voorkeur)
* Thuiswerkshop om je werkplek thuis optimaal in te kunnen richten, uiteraard met een mobiele telefoon & laptop
* 50% korting op KPN-producten en -diensten, zoals KPN-internet
* Een reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer: zoals onze fietsvergoeding van € 0,40 per kilometer, of € 0,23 per kilometer, of volledige vergoeding 2e klas OV. Daarnaast krijg je € 10,- per maand internetvergoeding en een thuiswerkvergoeding van € 2,15 per dag
* Uitstekende pensioenvoorwaarden: een totale inleg van 23% van je pensioengevende salaris waarvan KPN 16% inlegt en jij 7%


Ons geloof in technologie is groot. Dit wordt nóg krachtiger samen met menselijk contact, daarom ontmoeten we je graag!


Wil je meer weten? Neem contact op met onze recruiter.
**Wat gebeurt er**
**na je sollicitatie?**
------------------------------------------


**01**
**Telefonisch contact**
-----------------------


Onze recruiters leren je graag beter kennen en nemen daarom telefonisch contact met je op!
**02**
**Gesprekken**
--------------


Zijn we van beide kanten enthousiast? Dan plannen we een eerste, tweede en eventueel een derde gesprek en/of assesment in.
**03**
**Wij doen jou een aanbod**
---------------------------


Als alle gesprekken goed zijn gegaan, doen we je een aanbod. Een screening kan onderdeel zijn van dit proces.
**04**
**Welkom in het team**
----------------------


Als je blij bent met het aanbod en je het contract hebt getekend, begint jouw onboarding. Welkom bij KPN!
**Zie je een groene toekomst al voor je? Reageer!**
---------------------------------------------------


Voornaam

CV Uploaden (optioneel)


Ik ga akkoord met het privacy statement.


Verstuur sollicitatie

--------------------------------
